208111.name: Breakout (Issue 5 - 1982)
rpgissuearticle: A 1:1 Ratio for WWII: the Case for
Battle Diary: The Second Villers Bretonneux
Canberra Games Convention 1982 Australia Day Weekend
Computer Gaming on a Micro Budget
Under the Table: Corps Level Actions - Salamanca
208111.description:
The Australasian Gaming Quarterly

Title given as Breakout, not Breakout!

Breakout
Volume 2, Number 1
April/June 1982

208112.description:
Iron League:Black Stadium is a brutal tactical game utilizing Mechs, miniatures and interactive scenery for action-packed game play.

Configure your team with giant machines called Iron Mechs with interchangeable arms and weapons and warriors: the hordes of Claws, the heavy Zimman, your mechanic to repair your mechs. You can recruit mercenaries on your team.

Use drums full of gas in your favor, use walls to protect your warriors and be careful of fire squares. Throw the enemy into the air, or throw them at burning drum. Shoot down the Iron Mech pilots and steal their mechs, or destroy them.

With 4 game Modes: Match, Death Match, Arena and Cooperative. Nuke Tracker is a Expansion full Co-op supplementary to Iron League:Black Stadium.

Match: a tactical and ferocious sports game. Your team can be repaired after each goal.

Death Match: a competitive, destructive combat, if you survive you win. If your team dies, they cannot regenerate.

Arena: Inspired by MOBA style video games, if you destroy 2 enemy black holes or steal your enemy's plasma ball, you win. If your team dies, they can regenerate.

Coop: Survive waves of attacking enemies.

The game consists of 4 teams.

Each team contains 3 Iron Mechs, 3 Claws , 1 Zimman Warrior and 1 Mechanic. Iron Mechs are controlled by pilots with special abilities, but can be taken over by any warrior (mechanics are not warriors). If a warrior takes control of an Iron Mech, he loses his abilities, armor, and special weapons. So, he becomes a pilot but with limitations. There are also 4 mercenaries that can be hired during the game.
208112.name: Iron League: Black Stadium
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 035 – Top 25 of 2016

208113.description:
A set of cards sent to backers of the 2016 Kickstarter campaign for Alternate Histories, A Quartermaster General Expansion.

The set consists of six cards, all with the Alternative Histories logo on the back and the six armies on the front.

These cards are used to randomise armies at the start of the game.
208113.name: Quartermaster General: Alternative Histories – Player Selection Cards

208114.name: Le Cercle de Glace & L'Abîme
208114.description:
User summary:

French translation of two mini-solos for Tunnels & Trolls : Circle of Ice and The Abyss.

208115.name: Les jungles-araignées de Boomshartak
208115.description:
User summary:

This tongue-in-cheek adventure in French casts a marauding troop of jungle trolls — or whatever lowly character you'd fancy instead — into the deep groves of the Spiders Jungles of Boomshartak, a cursed and haunted tropical waste clinging to the steep side of the mountains as they rise towards the fabled land of the Nagas. Dare you go where flies the golden Shantak bird and cackle the wizard spiders?

208116.description:
A set of blank cards sent to backers of the 2016 Kickstarter campaign for Alternate Histories, A Quartermaster General Expansion.

Consisting of 12 blank cards, all with their relevant nations backs. These cards can be used to make custom cards or replace missing and/or damaged cards.
Item consists of:

2x Germany
2x United Kingdom
2x Italy
2x Soviet Union
2x Japan
2x United States
208116.name: Quartermaster General: Alternative Histories – Blank Cards

208117.name: Le Temple Obscur
208117.description:
User summary:

Are the followers of Krestok simple pilgrims, victimized by lies, or an evil cult seeking the magical Phoenix scroll to give their foul leader power over the land? The answer to your quest lies in the Dark Temple.
This solitaire adventure is suitable for low & mid-level humanoid characters, with adds of 10-75. Limited magic is allowed.
The French edition includes a map of Myre designed by Stefan Jones and drawn by Billiam Babble, a description of Myre and Environs by Stefan Jones, a short GM scenario set in Myre, written by Géraud “myvyrrian” G, and original illustrations by Earl Geier in addition to the classic Steve Crompton artwork.

208118.name: Thing Two and Thing One Whirly Fun! Game
208118.description:
Thing One and Thing Two are running around the house making messes! Work together to clean up the house before Mother gets home. If everything is tidy when Mother comes in the door, you all win!

This cooperative game is played inside the box, in which a small model of the house from The Cat in the Hat is built. Through random card draws, the house is messed up by the Things (a spinning top) and re-cleaned by the players.

208120.name: Thing Two and Thing One Whirly Fun Game
208120.description:
With Mother out of the house for the day, The Cat in the Hat has brought Thing One and Thing Two to play! Oh, but these Things run about with bumps, thumps, and kicks! Work together to clean up their mess before Mother comes home. It's cooperative fun for everyone!

Dr. Seuss Thing Two and Thing One Whirly Fun Game, is a family cooperative game where the players take on the role of the children in Dr. Seuss' classic Cat in the Hat story. Each player's turn will seem them making the house messy and drawing a card. These cards can allow them to clean the house or moving mother closer to the front door. The game ends when mother reaches the front door.

If mother reaches the door and the house is clean, then the players win. If mother reaches the door and the house is dirty, then the players lose.

208122.name: Mistborn: The Siege of Luthadel
208122.description:
Description from the publisher:

“Elend felt the ash dust his face and clothing, but he ignored it. In the distance, the bloody red sun was close to setting. It backlit the army that had come to take Elend's kingdom from him...”

The fall of the Lord Ruler is not the end for the Houses of Luthadel. Rather, it is the beginning of a whole new world, where fancy balls and courtly intrigue give way to wars of kings, social upheaval, and political strife. Amid the chaos, strange new beings rise at the fringes of society — hordes of rampaging koloss, eerie mist-spirits, and strange shape-shifting kandra... threatening the whole of civilization!

Much like Mistborn: House War follows the narrative of the first Mistborn novel, The Final Empire, The Siege of Luthadel details the trials and tribulations faced by the nobility during the events of Mistborn: The Well of Ascension. The players are leaders of the Houses left standing following the Final Empire’s collapse, and they must navigate the perils of dangerous new times. Their negotiations continue, but now there is another balance of power to consider...

This supplement’s major addition is the Siege, which divides players into two “teams:” one consisting of the Houses besieging Luthadel, and the other consisting of those defending it. The progress of the siege is represented on the Siege Track, a sideboard that imparts benefits to those on one side of the walls and new challenges to those on the other. Conditions on the Siege Track change regularly through the game, as certain Problems are solved or erupt.

Your choice of sides also changes how you’re affected by various Problems: whether you can take control of the koloss or the Skaa Assembly, for example, and how ready certain Personalities are to cooperate with you. Houses can change loyalties throughout the game as they maneuver for the greatest advantage, and this adds a whole new layer of intrigue and politicking to the Mistborn: House War!

Gameplay remains the same as in the core game, with players collaborating to solve Problems, gain Favor, and control (or manipulate) Unrest. When this expansion is used, the game ends when the Battle for Luthadel Problem card is solved or erupts, or when Unrest reaches 8, but there’s an additional twist! Only the highest or lowest score from the winning “team” can win the game. This gives players a reason to cooperate and collaborate, in addition to just “being on the right side of history” as the game comes to a close.

The Siege of Luthadel will also include revised and updated Problem and Personality decks, along with new House sheets to represent the thrilling events and storyline of The Well of Ascension. Now players can...

...face and solve issues like Spirits in the Mist, Koloss at the Walls, and Chaos in the Assembly.
...employ Personalities like Spies, Oracles, and even named characters from the second Mistborn novel!
...command the power of Houses Cett or Penrod, or new forms of old Houses like Lekal or Venture.




These new decks and Houses are designed to be easily swapped in and out with those in Mistborn: House War but for a true-to-the-novel experience you can play them right out of the box. The ways and effects of mixing and matching to make your own perfect story is one of the team’s primary focuses as the design comes together.

208123.description:
Oh no! Monty giant has returned to the city. If Monty stays in our city, it will finish destroying it!

Get calm Monty down and not get angry him or send him to another city.
But be careful, Monty can return at any time.

Monty´ll go city of each player, according to his mood, Monty can damage your city. Try save your city to survive and disturb Monty in the cities of the other players.

All players draw 3 cards, When Monty is in your city players will put cards to change the mood of Monty and if Monty is angry could destroy your city.
Defend your city and get Monty destroy the cities of the other players before your city.
208123.name: Monty The Giant
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

208124.name: ALONE?
208124.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Alone is a Psychological Horror game that changes around you as you play. When Sam receives a letter from his sister asking for help, he ventures back to the hostel where he grew up. Little did he know, what he was about to encounter.

Source: The Game Website.

208125.name: Fairy Tale Mysteries: The Puppet Thief
208125.description:
When evil Puppeter kidnaps souls of innocent children, you’re assigned your first mission as Brothers Grimms investigator – find a way to defeat the malefactor and bring rescue to all in need. Follow the trace of magical events to discover sorcerers blind spot. Use it to defeat him and bring home all who have been lost!

Once upon a time, there was a man who went from town to town with songs and poetry, capturing the souls of children. From generation to generation, the tale was told. But every fairy tale has its true bitter beginning.

Now a new evil has visited the town of Arbourshire, and children have been going missing. A mysterious puppet theatre seems to be at the centre of their disappearance. The town is in an uproar! A mob roams the streets and the Brothers Grimm have assigned to you the task of discovering the truth behind the Fairy Tale Mystery!

Discover the truth behind the myth and save the children!

Source: The Publisher Website.

208126.description:
These character meeples have been designed to be used in place of the plain plastic pawns that are included with Pandemic: The Cure. The following roles exist:
- Scientist (female)
- Researcher (female)
- Medic (male)
- Generalist (female)
- Dispatcher (male)
- Contingency Planner (male)
- Containment Specialist (male)
208126.name: Pandemic: The Cure – Character Meeples

208127.description:
These character meeples have been designed to be used in place of the plain :pawns that are included with Pandemic: In the Lab and Pandemic: On the Brink expansions. The following roles exist:
- Archivist (male)
- Bio-Terrorist (male)
- Containment Specialist (male)
- Epidemiologist (female)
- Field Director (male)
- Field Operative (male)
- Generalist (female)
- Local Liaison (female)
- Pilot (male)
- Troubleshooter (female)
- Virologist (female)
208127.name: Pandemic: In the Lab & On the Brink Character Meeples

208128.name: Ennuigi
208128.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Super Mario Bros..




Spend some time with a depressed, laconic Luigi as he chain smokes and wanders through a crumbling Mushroom Kingdom, ruminating on ontology, ethics, family, identity, and the mistakes he and his brother have made.

About the game

This is a shot at a collection of ideas I had a few years ago, about looking critically at the universe of Super Mario Bros. in light of the total lack of explicit narrative in the original game in particular. Who are these strange men? What motivates them? By what right do they wreak the havoc they do on this strange place? What do they feel about where they are and what they're doing?

And so, this is one lens through which to look at all that, with Luigi, the second brother, the also-ran, as a complicit onlooker, wandering now through some fractured, rotting liminal place in this strange world, reflecting on it all in scattered fragments.

Source: The Game Website.

208129.description:
These character meeples have been designed to be used in place of the plain pawns that are included with Pandemic: State of Emergency expansion. The following roles exist:
- First Responder (female)
- Pharmacist (male)
- Veterinarian (female)
- Gene Splicer (female)
- Colonel (male)
208129.name: Pandemic: State of Emergency – Character Meeples

208130.name: ChronoBlade
208130.description:
ChronoBlade takes place in the Multiverse where countless possible Earths exist, but each reality has been invaded by the army of the Chronarch Imperium. As a last resort, four survivors named Aurok, Lophi, Thera and Lucas decide to band together and found "ChronoBlade," the faction that can oppose Chronarchs and save reality itself.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ChronoBlade ChronoBlade]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208132.name: Super Senso
208132.description:
Why do they exist? Why are they here? Why does Tappi sound like Jarvis, Stephen Colbert, Wall.E and Lil' Wayne got together and decided to build a drone? Answers are coming...

Source: The Game Website.

208133.name: Epic Roll: Veteran Pack
208133.description:
Introduces Veteran game rules and Hero Cards to Epic Roll. Consists of Veteran Rulebook and three Hero Cards (Dara, Greff, and Orric).

Each Hero gains a unique Passive Ability and an Activated Ability which can be used during opponents' turns. Each player's maximum hand size is increased to three cards, and defeating the toughest monsters (Skeleton and Banshee) reward players with an additional treasure card. Players also gain the ability to play treasure cards in pairs to achieve 'Focused Effects'.

Packs are included with game purchases, and available for free at shows/events. The components are also available for download from EpicRoll.com

208134.description:
Danger is a party card game that is inspired by warning signs amped up to the hilariously absurd. It is a game about bizarre situations and the bizarre ways in which people are saved from them.

The first victim is the person who lives the most dangerously. Each of the other players is called a rescuer. The victim draws and reveals a danger card containing the perilous situation s/he is caught in. The rescuers then place one skill card and one tool card from their hands which they will utilize to save the victim. Each Rescuerer then presents their rescue plan and the Victim awards the Danger card to the Rescuer with the best plan. The first person to win three Dangers is the winner.
208134.name: Danger the Game

208135.name: Hunters Mark
208135.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.





From publisher blurb:Are you ready for the most brutal job in the world…where every fight is a boss fight? Can you co-operate with your rivals to take down the most dangerous monsters?

Hunters Mark provides you with an over-the-top storyline, bad-ass monster fights, and perilous lairs to plunder. Welcome to the bold world of monster hunting - where the only thing more savage than rampaging monsters are the hunters tasked to take them down. You’ll get everything you need in this book to expand your world including monster spoils, a new treasure option for characters!

120 full-color pages covering:
•30 Monsters
•28 Weapons & Armor
•24 Monster Spoils
•12 Pre-generated Hunters
•10 Guild Pets

208136.name: 輪廻戦記 Xenoscape
208136.description:
From the back of the book:

Xenoscape ... That is the dreams the earth dreams ---.
Xenoscape --- That is the sight no one can see. Even if there are people who get lost and stumble into it, there is no person who remembers it.
No one --- Yes, except for you.
There are people who are turning these dreams into nightmares. People who dive into the Xenoscape, having that power, maneuvering secretly in the shadow of history.
You remember. Fighting them is your appointed task. It is for that purpose that you have been reincarnated.
Their ...... "The Light Bringers"' power is mighty. That power reaches both into the surface world as well as into the secret world.
But there is nothing to fear. You have the power of your previous existences, the divine protection of the stars.
And most importantly, because you have the strong will to cut a path through destiny.

Destiny --- And the power to cut a path through it
In "輪廻戦記Xenoscape", the players are reincarnated persons and have to fight various groups who are trying to influence history from the back.
And in order to fight them, the players remember their previous existences, gaining new powers through their awakening.
Their powers are determined by the two factors of the 7 "pieces" and 17 "aspects".
The piece is the power a character has to cut a path through destiny, and also the character's style. Characters can use special skills depending on their piece which are compared to chess pieces.
In addition, corresponding to 17 celestial bodies, the aspect is a character's destiny, meaning the various special powers that reincarnated have and their lineage.
Characters can use special abilities based on their aspect.

Dual Layer Scenario
Scenarios for this RPG are made up of two layers overcoming time and space.
One layer is as characters in the present. And another is the layer of visions of previous lives that appear in dreams.
Those two get deeply entangled as they progress at the same time - . That is "輪廻戦記Xenoscape".

Idea Spirits
The thing representing the previous lives of the characters are idea spirits - "I's".
Various famous people from history. Gods and heroes who have left their names in legends and tradition. Of course, it is also okay for them to be original persons.
With each scenario, or via awakening points (experience value) you can remember and gain new I's.
You can squeeze the character in one I's and have it develop, or you can also proceed by dividing things up using various.

Table Talk RPG is?
It is the journey to a different world. Living another life.
The story taking place taking command of people's discussion and power of imagination sometimes even rivals a single human life.
You, who has visited many world carrying the power of words and the strength of your will, will end up weaving irreplacable tales as an "eternal champion".

208137.name: Cloud Giant's Bargain
208137.description:
From the back cover:

The renowned adventuring company Acquisitions Inc. hires you to infiltrate a castle--but not just any castle. This is a flying fortress built by the cloud giant Count Stratovan, who is currently preparing to destroy the Sword Coast.

Your mission is to meet with his son, who claims to want to prevent the war and establish peace between the giants and the small folk. If you can learn whether the son can be trusted, discover the secrets of the castle, and... well, survive, you too can earn acclaim with Acquisitions Inc.!


User summary:

Free adventure given out at Fathom event for PAX West Acquisitions Inc. game, 4 September 2016.

208138.description:
A spin-off of the cute and casual card game Tiny Swords, Tactics is a completely new game. Flip, slide, and toss other player's tiles away to be the last one standing.

Keep your tiles close to the Heart of the Battle, and toss your foes away. If a tile is disconnected from all other tiles, that player has until the end of their turn to get it back to the battle or risk losing it forever! Tiles that are face-up can be pushed and tossed, while face-down tiles can act as walls to contain the ever-increasing chaos. Every time you toss a tile, they accumulate more Toss Tokens and get flung further each time, pushing any face-up tiles in their path!

On top of that, each team has their own Captain with unique powers. Utilize each Captain's ability to turn the tide of battle and knock the other players off of your actual table. The whole table is your stage!
208138.name: Tiny Swords Tactics

208139.name: Geek-opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
208139.description: Classic game of Monopoly with a geek twist. Most prominent gameplay change is trivial questions on Community Chest and Chance cards.

208140.name: The Ritual
208140.description:
A Hideous Plot in Which Murder is Just the Start

From the introduction:

This adventure is suitable for inexperienced or beginning player characters. It is set in Delberz, but could be used in any urban setting. It pits the PCs against Skaven and their human allies.

In this adventure, the PCs witness a cultist, Peter Tavelli, chasing and seemingly trying to kill a young man, who begs for their help. Pursuing Tavelli leads the PCs to a dangerous underground complex where a band of Skaven, led by Skretth – an unusually dangerous specimen – have joined forces with a group of human cultists. Can the PCs prevent the terrible ritual these groups are planning, and save themselves into the bargain?

User summary:

Note the PDF is formatted "two-up" for booklet printing. The PDF has 14 pages; a printed and folded booklet would have 28 pages.

208141.name: Eureka!
208141.description:
A Hideous Plot in Which Murder is Just the Start

From the introduction:

Eureka! takes place in the city of Nuln in the Empire, although it could easily be any other Old World city. It is designed for 3-6 first-career player characters (PCs), and makes an excellent introductory adventure (or convention scenario) as it can easily be completed in a single session. It can also be added to an existing campaign as a fun aside, for even though Eureka! is intended for adventurers on their first career, it can still provide an interesting challenge to veteran groups.

This scenario first appeared in White Dwarf (Issue 93 - Sep 1987), and was later reprinted, with some changes, in The Restless Dead. This version of the scenario, updated for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay (2nd Edition), retains the original setting of the White Dwarf article.

208142.name: The Ballad of Stanislav Benq
208142.description:
From the introduction:

Karloff Kekyin had a son; a man of both his fathers virtue and vice but sadly very little else. Giorgi Kekyin has taken it upon himself to finish off his father's collection of fanciful historic wonders and top of his list is a very specific item long denied his family from Svetsk. He has taken the somewhat impersonal approach of hiring a small band of “Specialists” from the empire to find and retrieve it.

208143.name: Ten Little Goblins
208143.description:
From the introduction:

Ten Little Goblins invites you to an exciting night of murders, mystery and horror. Playing Sherlock Holmes around a good haunch of meat and a keg of Bugman’s XXXXXX can be a real fun for your friendly [player characters]. There is only one problem: they are part of the meal!

Based on one of Agatha Christie’s famous novels with a personal dark touch, this adventure should create excitement then fear among your players.

Since this scenario can be very deadly, it is best for the players to create special characters for this one night adventure or to use one of the ten characters given with this scenario.

208144.name: Imperial Ogres
208144.description:
From the introduction:

This character supplement provides you with all of the rules required to include Ogre Player Characters in a game centred in the Empire.

[Game Masters] thinking of adding Ogre PCs to their game should seriously consider the impact of such a move. Not only are Ogres particularly strong in combat, which can imbalance certain scenarios, they are also very weak in social situations, which many WFRP adventures focus upon. Ogres are not as accepted by the general folk of the Old World as Elves and Dwarves (primarily due to their belligerent natures), which can have massive repercussions on the enjoyment of playing an Ogre, who may have to miss, or will simply ruin, subtler adventures.

208145.name: Bomb Arena
208145.description:
Game description from the designer:

Bomb Arena is a party game. Friends can team up to fight against each other. Players work together to put bombs to rival's field and do their best igniting them. Boom!!

It's fun and exciting to use bomb cards and accumulate explosion power with skill cards and team member's help. On the one side, you have to do your best to deal damage to your opponent's team, on the other side, you have to rack your brains removing the bombs in your field.

Players of Bomb Arena usually love to have one more match, two more matches right after the 1st game because it is really fun.
Players keep mesmerized when they play Bomb Arena because every player's movement would affect each other dramatically. You would be excited during the whole game.

HOw to ignite bombs?

There are 3 ways to ignite bombs devil
1. 11 kings of Bomb Cards : No.2 ~ No. 12
We deal 3 bomb cards and 2 skill cards to each player.
Each player take turns placing one bomb card on enemy's field.
When players work together and put 5 bomb cards in a row on enemy's
field, !!BOOM!! It will deal 2 damage to enemy's team.

for example, when you and your team member put
No.2, No.3, No4, No5, No.6 bomb cards on your enemy's field, it explodes.

2. Skill card: Time Bomb
A player can put a time bomb and attache it on a Bomb on enemy's field.

for example, a player can put time bomb on No.7 Bomb card which is already on the filed. then every next player needs to throw 2 dice to
check if it will explode or not. Every player needs to throw 2 dice during the beginning of his turn until the time bomb explodes.

3. When 3 bomb cards of the same number are piled up.
the 3 bomb cards explode immediately can cause 1 point damage.

Players can use counterattack, remove, provoke, designate or other skill cards to make the game more interesting.

208147.name: Crazy Toaster
208147.description:
Crazy Toaster is for younger kids and is a simple game of collecting food.

Sounds simple but the fun part is you put the food in the toaster, the food pops out just like a real toaster and the kids have to catch it in their pans.

Collect all you can but watch out you don't want to catch a rotten fish or you have to give back a piece of toast.

208148.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 3.09 - Sept 2016)
208148.description:
Misfits in Action
Volume 3, Issue 9
September 2016

Earl Geier Presents: Half Skeleton
Eric Lofgren Presents: Shield Up
Jason Moser Presents: A Woman to Die For
Scott Harshbarger Presents: Wolfman
Earl Geier Presents: Haunted Ruins

208149.name: Popular Adult Names in 1930's America
208149.description:
User summary:

Includes four 1d100 tables of names; 200 male names and 200 female names. Presents given names only (e.g., no surnames).

208150.name: The Adventurer's Guide to Excavation and Plunder
208150.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[N]ew rules, races, classes, monsters and more - all in two pages.

User summary:

A minimalist supplement for the minimalist "old school" game system. Presents a variety of ideas and items for the game.

208151.description:
Ed the cat, Wer fährt seine Krallen aus? is an easy to learn short little card game. The object of the game is to get rid of your hand cards faster than your opponents and collecting as few points as possible. On your turn simply play one of your cards, if one player manages to get rid of all his hand cards at the end of his turn the current round ends and you start a new one. If one player collected 99 or more points at the end of a round the game ends and the player with the fewest points wins.

Game description from the back of the box:

Dieses Kartenspiel hat es in sich:
Es ist so einfach wie Mau-Mau - und doch so listig wie ein Miezekätzchen.
Wer verpasst seinen Mitspielern die meisten Strafpunkte, ohne selbst welche zu bekommen?
Und wer wird als Ersters seine Karten los?
208151.name: Ed, the Cat: Wer fährt seine Krallen aus?

208156.name: 9-Masu Shogi
208156.description:
9-Masu Shogi is played on a tiny three-by-three square board using only eight of the original Shogi’s types of pieces.

Movements and the goal of checkmate remain, but unlike regular Shogi there are 40 different starting positions to choose from.

208157.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are spanners in the works which may help (or hinder) you.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
208157.name: Réunion & Mauritius (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

208158.name: Terrible Monster: Desperation
208158.description: The Terrible Monster: Desperation expansion consists of twelve cards to add to your game of Terrible Monster. The additional monster and spells can just be mixed into the original game. The new heroes, however, are a brand new gameplay feature of this expansion; instead of playing a card, a player can choose to use the ability of their hero. These abilities cannot be countered by counter tokens!

208159.name: Tangled Trails
208159.description:
Players travel a path from the top of the board to the bottom by playing cards. Cards can also be used to impede opponents.

Cards either have a number (1-5) of squares to move in one direction, a "star" that lets a player advance to a corner or fork, a "circled star" that allows a player to move another player's piece to a star square, or an "X" that forces a player to skip a turn.

208160.name: Grubboonch!: Hill Giants are Bad Kings
208160.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Grubboonch is a stupid gluttounous, foul, demented monster, even by the standards of hill giants. He has taken over a small town, and it is up to the PCs to deal with him somehow, before he finishes all the cows and starts eating people.

This is a short adventure for 3-5 PCs level 3-4. It is meant to serve as a companion piece to Storm Kings Thunder. In it, there are opportunities for PCs to interact with a Cloud Giant and a Hill giant, and to participate in their schemes.

This adventure is not a dungeon crawl. It is based around the interactions between the PCs, the Giant that threatens the town, the Villagers who fear him and the Con man who tries to manipulate him. It contains detailed background on NPCs and environment in order to support those interactions.

208161.name: Pokémon TCG - Jungle Expansion
208161.description:
Jungle is the name given to the first expansion of new cards and Theme Decks for the Pokémon Trading Card Game. Are you ready to explore the jungle? If you look hard, you`ll find 48 new Pokemon Trading Card Game cards in the exciting Jungle expansion for the Pokemon trading card game.

----

Collect all the Jungle cards and you`ll discover awesome new holographic cards with super attacks - a must for every Pokemon collector! Each pre-constructed theme deck contains 60 cards, a cardboard holographic foil Vileplume coin, 10 damage counters, and an english rulebook.

208162.name: Pokémon TCG - Fossil Expansion
208162.description:
Fossil (Japanese: Mystery of the Fossils) is the name given to the third expansion of cards and Theme Decks for the Pokémon Trading Card Game in both America and Japan. The set's booster pack designs feature Lapras, Kabutops, and Zapdos.


With this Pokemon Fossil Lockdown Pre-Constructed Theme Deck comes with 60 mint Pokemon collectible trading cards. You also a cardboard holographic foil Aerodactyl coin, 10 damage counters, and an english rulebook.

208163.name: Palace of the Viper
208163.description:
From the introduction:

Before the Ten Desert Lords of the Gates took power, the desert was in the power of the Bandits of Farea. These scoundrels only lived for power and riches but held secret oaths with each other and formed a bond never broken for nearly six hundred years.

User summary:

For 8th - 10th level characters. This intriguing modules has unusually high production values.

208164.name: Pokémon TCG - Team Rocket Expansion
208164.description: Team Rocket (Japanese: Rocket Gang) is the name given to an expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game. As its name implies, it was themed around the exploits of Team Rocket.

208165.description: This game is an homage to the great designer Alex Randolph. Basically, it is Ricochet Robots made with a postcard. A player throws a postcard at the center of a table, all the players try to figure out what is the minimum amount of overturn on its side the postcard must do to touch the edge of the table, the player that said the smallest number must check the claim. If he/she was right the player cuts the first border of the postcard (see the image) and keep it as a token of his/her points. Otherwise the player cuts the border and crumple it up as a negative point. the postcard is now more irregular and smaller, therefore is harder to guess right. If a player collect 2 crumpled up tokens is out of the game, the game end when everybody is eliminated or the card cannot be cut anymore (end of the dotted lines. The survived player in the first case or the player with the most stars in their token in the second case is the winner.
208165.name: Ricochet Postcard

208166.name: Unbox
208166.description:
Unbox is a 90s style 3D platformer about the ultimate postal service, self-delivering cardboard boxes! Unbox has giant worlds full of challenges, collectibles and boxy boss battles!

Source: The Game Website.

208167.name: Space Rangers: Quest
208167.description:
User Summary

A new text adventure in the world of Space Rangers.

208168.name: Aim Hero
208168.description:
Aim Hero is an ultimate solution for practicing firing accuracy to do better in FPS games.

Source: The Game Website.

208169.name: The Odyssey
208169.description:
Step into this epic point-and-click mythical adventure game. See what it takes to be the Greek hero Odysseus (Ulysses)! Get ready to embark on a journey filled with danger, mythical creatures and ancient Gods.

Source: The Developer Website.

208170.description:
Stellar Armada is a starship combat wargame for two players that deletes the complexities of maneuvering in favor of focusing on system management.

Each player has a game mat with representations of ship systems. Players take turns activating ship systems in an attempt to destroy their opponent.

Gameplay is a balance of decision making and luck. The game uses dice to determine outcomes, but allows for probabilities to be adjusted by expending ship resources. These resources dwindle throughout gameplay forcing players to take greater risks.
208170.name: Stellar Armada
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 029 – Why Jam Improves Your Game
The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 67: Sunday, September 18th

208171.description:
When humans were tired of dreary monoculture and the dull design products of the food industries, they decided to provide each citizen with a piece of land to make them self-sufficient. In order to use the area in an optimal way, the smartest of them drew on a cultivation method that includes the dimension of height and brings out naturally grown stories: the agroforestry. Thus, the woodland gardeners were born, and they now face the task of transforming their wasteland into a productive garden of trees and shrubs with edible fruits and seeds. There are several factors to be considered when laying out the gardens: the light and space requirements of the fruit trees, as well as the time of their flowering and maturing, and whether a species needs a partner for fertilization. Otherwise, the players' efforts will not result in a rich harvest.

Who cultivates the most valuable woodland garden in Waldgärtner wins. Gaining the right cards, and placing or discarding them at the right time will lead to your horticultural success!
208171.name: Waldgärtner
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 551 - Waldgärtner, Inis, and Dokmus

208172.name: Misery in Meadowland
208172.description:
From the introduction:

Thirty-five years ago the Meadow Tower, located in Meadowland, fell into ruins. Over the course of several years the dark and alien influence of EtunakaimaR spread out from a nearby cave, to be found straight west of the Meadow family's burial mound, and infected the entire area, completely surrounding the tower – and forcing everybody living there to flee.

User summary:

For three or more 1st level characters

208173.name: Skills for MYFAROG
208173.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This small book contains the same information about the skills as the core rule book, but also has several tables with modifications for many skills - to help beginners understand how to determine the difficulty of different tasks, and also to enable experienced players to easily and quickly have access to some more advanced lists of modifications for the skills. The purpose of this book is to enable myth masters and players alike to fast and easily be able to look up on the skill modifications and skills in general.

208174.name: Spells & Favours for MYFAROG
208174.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This small and handy book is intended for players who play sorcerers and for religious characters, who may wish to quickly look up some spell/favour. There are no new spells/favours in this book, only those found in the MYFAROG core rule book. NB: You need MYFAROG in order to make use of this book.

208175.name: Travels & Treasures for MYFAROG
208175.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Every great adventure starts with a journey, and every journey with a single step. Travels & Treasures enables myth masters to easily and quickly enhance their adventures, to cast the adventurers into unforeseen situations and unexpected events. Every single journey will become an opportunity for adventure, every single encounter a believable and interesting situation. Travels & Treasures also facilitates the crafting of adventures, and the treasures potentially found in them.

208176.name: Men & Monsters for MYFAROG
208176.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Men & Monsters for MYFAROG presents most of the men and all the monsters you can encounter in Thulê. Each named NPC from the MYFAROG core rule-book, most NPC categories (e.g. Civilian Hunters, Khemetian Merchant Guards, Rangers, Cultists, Assassins, etc.) with different experience levels, and all the monsters each have a separate stat block. There are also a few new creatures (Giant Toad, Rat Swarm, Cursed Tree, Crawling Creep, Large Forest Ettin/Ogre, Small Forest Ettin/Yrch, Elf Queen, Dwarf Lord, Ancient Hulda, Ancient Skeleton, Warrior Wight, Ancient Ghost, Ancient Sea Wraith/Wraith and Shadow Sorcerer) in this book.

208177.name: Curses & Gifts for MYFAROG
208177.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Curses & Gifts is a small supplement for MYFAROG, with a variety of new options for myth masters and players alike, as well as more setting information. Most of the contents is related to the religion of Thulê, but there is also other new contents. Some of the information in this small book was included in the first edition of MYFAROG, but most of the information is brand new, and all of it is adjusted to the second edition of the game. Most of the new rules and information in this booklet are very modular, meaning you can easily include them, or only parts of them, if you so wish.

208178.name: The Coming for MYFAROG
208178.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A science-fantasy supplement using the MYFAROG rules. This includes a new post apocalyptic setting based on our own world, were you can play survivalist games, conspiracy theory games, sci-fi games, war games, zombie apocalypse games or the like. Adds rules for the use of modern firearms and explosives, flaws, radiation, critical hit tables, mental health, suppression and the use of some new primitive mêlée weapons. You can use many of these rules in the classic MYFAROG setting as well - not least the flaws, critical hits tables and mental health rules.

208179.name: Interregnum
208179.description:
A card game of courtly politics and intrigue
His Royal Majesty is dying. Stricken with sudden illness our king failed to anoint a successor. Now a ruthless game begins between his sons, daughters and bastards.

Outmaneuver your rivals.
Gain support of key figures at the court.
Become the next king.

In Interregnum, 3-5 players strive to build a coterie of influential nobles, courtiers and soldiers who will support their claim to the throne. Important members of the court can help persuade others to join your cause, but even lowly servants often hear rumours that you may use as leverage.
Other contenders will use whatever influence they have to stop you, so rotten compromises and short-term alliances will be necessary on the way.

On each of his turns the active player chooses one character card he wishes to recruit and one or more cards that strengthen the bid. Other players may then decide to forfeit cards from their hands in order to block the recruitment.

On a successful recruitment the character (card) stays in play and provides ongoing benefits as well as Power (VP) to the owner.

Once a player gathers enough Power he or she may proclaim victory.

Only if you play your cards right and outsmart the competition - the crown will be yours.

208180.name: Duke Dedrakon (G-Core)
208180.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Duke Dedrakon, a terrible despot seeking his own demise. Cursed with immortality by a secretive order, the Duke will destroy any who cross his path. Includes full stats with tactical and plot suggestions.

208181.name: Crimson Gargoyle (G-Core)
208181.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Crimson Gargoyle. Once a prominent Neurologist, Dr Rudd is now a demented crusader for 'the people'. She believes she is freeing others from fear but all the while is subjecting them to the terror she fears.

208182.name: Major USA (Supers!)
208182.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Major USA. Donning a specialized suit and strapping on a pair of custom revolvers, he declared himself a symbol, fighting for America. He would become Major USA.

208183.name: Druid Spells I (PRD)
208183.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level druid spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208184.name: Druid Spells I (3PP)
208184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level druid spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208185.name: Cleric/Oracle Spells II (3PP)
208185.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Cleric/Oracle Spells is a simple document that collects the cleric/oracle spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level cleric/oracle spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208186.name: Cleric/Oracle Spells II (PRD)
208186.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Cleric/Oracle Spells is a simple document that collects the cleric/oracle spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level cleric/oracle spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208187.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Cantrips (PRD)
208187.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level sorcerer/wizard spells (cantrips)

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208188.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Cantrips (3PP)
208188.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level sorcerer/wizard spells (cantrips)

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208189.name: Paladin Spells I (3PP)
208189.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Paladin Spells is a simple document that collects the paladin spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level paladin spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208190.name: Paladin Spells I (PRD)
208190.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Paladin Spells is a simple document that collects the paladin spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level paladin spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208191.name: Final Fleet
208191.description:
A lone interstellar fleet must travel across a distant and perilous galaxy in the hope of reaching safety. Final Fleet is a Virtual Reality space shooter.

Source: The Developer Website.

208192.name: Spellbound (2016)
208192.description:
Spellbound is a virtual reality game which lets you enter into storybooks and be one of the characters. Stop living a boring life, put on your robe and wizard hat, and become a real wizard!

Source: The Game Website.

208193.name: World of Fishing
208193.description:
World of Fishing is a unique mix of Fishing Simulation and full-fledged MMO featuring character development, exciting quests and the addicting hunt for rare fish. Starting out with a small boat and basic equipment, players work their way up to catch huge fish like tunas and sharks.

Source: The Game Website.

208194.name: GE Neuro
208194.description:
Take a journey through the mind of musician Reuben Wu whose real life brain data was scanned with an MRI to create this VR portal into the human brain. Created by Kite & Lightning in partnership with GE & AMD.

Source: The Developer Website.

208195.name: Chaos Of Hearts
208195.description:
Chaos Of Hearts - a unique virtual world, which absorbed the best sides of modern online games

Source: The Game Website.

208196.name: DOGOS
208196.description:
DOGOS invites you to explore 14 original open world levels completely made in 3D, giving players the opportunity to meet goals from any angle they can imagine!

Source: The Developer Website.

208197.name: Reverence: The Ultimate Combat Experience
208197.description:
Experience real sword fighting in Reverence. With total control over your body, you carve your own destiny in this first and third person, multiplayer, combat experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

208198.name: Outbreak: Pandemic Evolution
208198.description:
User Summary

Outbreak is a first person survival game.

208199.name: PRINCIPIA: Master of Science
208199.description:
Principia:Master of Science is a simulation game with the theme of European science in 17th century. Player will choose one of real scientists in those era like Isaac Newton and proceed on the research. It's the time even the word "Science" didn't exist. Who can be the master of science?

Source: The Developer Website.

208201.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2016 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

This promo introduces a new Building Card that you can use in the game. The building card enables cider and resource uses and Victory Points, when the card is added to your village.

Pep McDonald and Rodney Smith are depicted on the card, with the Watch It Played logos on barrels.
208201.name: Above and Below: Watch It Played Building promo card

208202.name: Day of the Trumplings
208202.description:
User Summary

A controversial game on modern politics.

208203.name: Herbalism and Pharmacy in the Old World
208203.description:
From the introduction:

The Herbalist is a person who has an intimate knowledge of the
bounty of the plant world around them. They know which plants can be used for the relieving of painful insect bites and which can produce painful death. Many Herbalist are residents of rural communities that have little access to the luxuries of city life where healing may be administered by trained professionals. They typically receive their knowledge from ancient traditions handed down from parent to child since time immemorial. More cosmopolitan Herbalists may set up practices in cities and towns in order to administer cheap remedies to those who cannot afford a surgeon's or pharmacist's fees.

208204.name: The Eye of the Tiger
208204.description:
From the introduction:

The Eye Of The Tiger is a short scenario that can be played in a night or two of play, depending on your group’s playing style.

The scenario is a city-based adventure that can be dropped into any decently sized town or city that the Player Characters (PCs) visit, with little or no effort.

A playing party with one or more characters who are proficient in combat and a mix of social/thieving skills would be an advantage.

To allow the Games Master to make the scenario a challenge to any level of play, a variety of strength of opponents has been given for the Fighting Ring scenes found later in the scenario.

208205.name: New Careers
208205.description:
User summary:

This fan-made supplement presents several new basic careers for the game, including: Buyer, Jester, Teamster, Watercoachman, Lawyer, Longshank, Longshank Veteran, Playwright, Travelling Judge, Village Headman, and Wise Woman.

208206.name: The Rat-A-Jacks
208206.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is designed primarily as an investigation, centred on the fear and rumours of the Ratmen called the Skaven. While combat is also included within the plot line, the final confrontation does not have to be a show of arms. That said, I have included a few ideas on how to make the game more combat heavy for tougher player parties.

The adventure is also based upon events that happened in the town many years ago, in the V1-WFRP Adventure The Ritual from The Restless Dead, and so I have set the adventure in the town of Delberz. However, this can be changed if necessary by a GM, as long has the adventure still takes place in a town-sized settlement.

208207.name: The Ties That Bind (WFRP)
208207.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure can be played at any point in the middle of a campaign, or used as a way to introduce a new group of characters to each other under adverse circumstances. It should provide sufficient challenges for a group in a basic or first advanced career, and offer some interesting situational roleplaying along the way.

The scenario begins during the harvest season at a coaching inn situated in the fertile farmlands fed by the Aver River. You can easily place it in any isolated farming village along any river in the Empire and even adjust the time of year as necessary to suit your campaign. The original setting was north of the Aver, between the river and the Stirhügel, but should be adaptable anywhere.

208208.name: Mutiny: A Pirate's Jolly Game of Dice and Back-Stabbing
208208.description:
In Mutiny: A Pirate's Jolly Game of Dice and Backstabbing, players take on the roles of 2-6 pirates, trying to horde gold while attempting to escape a steadily sinking ship. In this case, the captain may not go down with the ship, but you can bet everyone else will!

Mutiny was introduced in concept during the 2014 rpggeek.com VirtuaCon digital convention event. At that time it was called "Pirates of the Sinking Ship".

The rules for Mutiny are simple: Using five, or perhaps six, standard dice, players roll for values of 3-5, hoping to amass wealth, 6's to board the lifeboat on which the gold is stored, while attempting to avoid 1's and 2's, which sink the ship.

When the ship reaches a water level of 20 fathoms, the ship sinks, with all aboard except whichever clever pirate has snuck aboard the lifeboat and made away with the treasure.

This game also includes Rum cards, which can be spent to gain initiative to roll dice. However, when a player's number is rolled, his rum card must be spent. Therefore, all players will receive an opportunity to roll the dice (and hopefully board the lifeboat) at least once.

Mutiny is played over a course of 3 separate games. Player character abilities shift each game, and are related to numbers also used to initiate a player's turn.

1) When this player is aboard the lifeboat, 1's rolled increase the water level by 2 fathoms.

2) This player may reroll any 2's rolled during his turn.

3) This player may keep his Rum card until he chooses to spend it to take his turn.

4) This player adds 2 gold to the lifeboat whenever he rolls a 4.

5) This player acquires 1 gold for his own personal pocket whenever anyone rolls his number during turn initiation. (The gold is added to his score at game end, provided he has won at least one of the three games.)

6) This player rolls six dice, instead of 5.

May the best backstabbing mutineer win!

208209.name: The Curse of the Crimson Pirate
208209.description:
From the introduction:

The people of Halpstadt live in fear. A few weeks ago the ghost of Valamir the Crimson, an evil pirate burned in the village many years ago, returned and began haunting the lands around the village. However when the PCs investigate they will find that the haunting never really took place, it was all a trick designed by the local landlords to keep the villagers from investigating a slaver band operating in the area.

208210.name: Fimir: A Supplement to the Old World Bestiary
208210.description:
From the introduction:

The Fimir are a race of cyclopean humanoid swamp dwellers that fear the light of the sun, which they call 'The Great Burning Eye' in their degenerate tongue. Direct sunlight disorients them and they prefer to move about under the aegis of a mystic fog which some of their race can invoke. They are quick to put buildings that other races have discarded to their own uses. Fimir abide by a strict caste system that they are “born” into. The Fimir have great barrel chests with short legs and three-toed clawed feet that are excellent for gripping marshy ground. Their bodies appear to be flabby, but they hide deceptive strength. Their large heads are mostly hairless and taper to a noseless tusked snout. Their infamous single eyes are pupil-less and are typically coloured either amber or milky-white. They have long snake-like tails and smooth leathery hides.

208211.name: With a Little Help from my Friends
208211.description:
A Short Adventure for a Small Party

From the introduction:

With a Little Help From My Friends is a short adventure designed for a small party of adventures. A magic user will be useful, as will at least one rogue type character.

The encounter locations use Middenheim as an example, though any medium or largesized city in the Old World will do just as well. You could also insert the adventure as part of the Paths of the Damned series, in Middenheim itself, Altdorf or Nuln, but be careful of giving the adventures too much to do.

The encounter is designed to give players a chance to think before they bash. There’s been a kidnapping, and the adventures are hired to rescue the hostage. The characters should consider their rescue carefully, but may have to improvise quickly if things don’t go quite according to plan.

User summary:

Note the PDF is formatted "two-up" for booklet printing. The PDF has 12 pages; a printed and folded booklet would have 24 pages.

208212.name: Piotr Put the Kettle On, Khurgan Take it Off Again
208212.description:
From the introduction:

Long before the Empire, long even before Sigmar, a warrior chief named Khurgan ruled over an area of what would become southern Stirland. His lands were a comparative oasis of calm in those chaotic and frightening times. In time, as he does to all the Lord of Dreams came to take Khurgan to dwell in the halls of his forefathers. His body was laid in a cave overlooking the most important of his halls so he could watch over his people in death as he had done in life. As his champions also joined their father's they were too laid in the cave to protect their lord for all eternity.

208213.name: An Inclusive Introduction to Agitations
208213.description:
From the introduction:

Sources [for this compilation product] include Across the Board, Beasts in Velvet, Genevieve Undead, 2.0: Spires of Altdorf, 3.0: Forges of Nuln and White Dwarf.

User summary:

Note the PDF is formatted "two-up" for booklet printing. The PDF has 14 pages; a printed and folded booklet would have 28 pages.

208214.name: A Wolf Rider Holiday
208214.description:
From the introduction:

A hard ride on the twelfth night before Geheimnisnacht to fields of gold wheat, vineyard vines, shepherd shacks and villages with low walls. The goblin gourds have all been carved, their fires flickering inside, it is time to rise out of hiding, grab a spear and ride the wolves through falling leaves and floating ash. Months of preparation and a night to burn it all. Even goblins have their holidays.
...
This adventure was not designed to be run start to finish. This is a collection of encounters that occur the day before and through the night of Nazee Swoopa’s Goblin Holiday. All encounters have a connection to each other and are designed so that the players, through their decisions and actions, will dictate the direction the adventure will take.

208215.name: The Green Man
208215.description:
From the introduction:

This scenario details a single night in a coaching inn. It is an eventful night with lots of action and the GM should make some notes and read it through a few times before running it. There are plenty of NPCs for your players to interact with. Don’t worry if the various plots interact or clash with each other, that is part of the fun. Your players will add their own particular blend of WFRP mayhem to the mix. This adventure is suitable for characters in their first or second careers. Don’t be intimidated, run the events at a steady pace and remember to have fun. We had a lot of fun writing it!

208216.name: Crawling Under A Broken Moon (Issue 15 - Oct 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Other Ways to Enter the Dome
The Red Claw Raiders mercenary company
The Western Half of the Park
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
208216.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the 15th issue of Crawling Under A Broken Moon, a fanzine dedicated to bringing gonzo post apocalyptic content for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG from Goodman Games.

This issue contains:

The 2nd half of the Dinotastic Park semi-hex crawl

Another slew of new monstous denizens living under the glowing dome

Two new character classes:
> the Cro-Mentalist - a powerfully psychic Once-man
> the Robo-priest - An empowered servant of the benevolent Ultimospark

and much, much more!

208217.description:
After many millennia, Hypnos is leaving the throne. Now it belongs to the Morpheus, Hypnos' right hand and son. Morpheus must make sure that dreams leave Oniria to the world and minds of mortals at the same rate as to this moment, otherwise Earth is doomed to regress of thinking and Oniria – to annihilation. Mortals need dreams to think, remember and stimulate their imagination, Oniria needs sleeping humans to exist – without dreamers Oniria will be left without power. But Morpheus cannot rule Kingdom of Dreams and create dreams and send them alone. That is why he needs an assistant. He makes a competition – Dreamweavers have three months (this is rather foggy, time in Oniria works – like most things – differently than in mortal world) to weave the most dreams with the most powerful oniric energies – the best weaver will become Morpheus’ right hand, and simultaneously second most powerful creature in Oniria.

Morpheus is a game for 2-4 players in which players will create dreams. At the beginning of each turn, the active player rolls the dice. Then, players will choose the dice and according to the number they will get different gifts, with essence among them. After that, at certain locations Dreamweavers can assign the essence to dreams and completing them. Other gifts include Chronite, a rare mineral able to bend time, used as a currency and Onirite, a device which can bend the structure of Oniria, allowing players to take additional actions. Dreamweavers will travel through the land of Oniria exactly three months of game-time, which equals 21 turns. The board is randomly assembled from tiles and dreamweavers will go a full circle from location to location. Player who creates the most powerful dreams and collects the most victory points wins the game and becomes right hand and assistant of Morpheus.
208217.name: Morpheus
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 028 – 10 Games for Essen

208218.name: Pakjesavond
208218.description: Pakjesavond is a micro game about Sinterklaas and the missing presents. Up to five players try to find the location of these presents using the powers of the Pieten (played by children in the images) and Sinterklaas himself. The player who finds most presents by the end of the game is considered to be the best helper by Sinterklaas and wins the game.

208219.name: Sensible World of Soccer
208219.description:
Sensible World of Soccer was designed and developed by Sensible Software as the 1994 sequel to their 1992 hit game Sensible Soccer which combined a 2D football game with a comprehensive manager mode. The game includes contemporary season data of professional football from around the world, with a total amount of approximately 1,500 teams and 27,000 players.

Although the gameplay is simple (eight directions and one fire button) a large variety of context sensitive actions can be performed without any predefined keys.

The game was ranked best game of all time by Amiga Power. In 2007 Henry Lowood, Curator for History of Science and Technology Collections in the Stanford University together with game designers Warren Spector and Steve Meretzky, researcher Matteo Bittanti and journalist Christopher Grant compiled a definitive list of "the ten most important video games of all time". This list included Sensible World of Soccer alongside such groundbreaking titles as Spacewar!, Tetris, SimCity and Doom. Sensible World of Soccer's inclusion in this list is notable on three accounts: it is the only game in the list developed in Europe, it is the only sports game in the list, and it is the most recent game in the list.

Title song
"Goalscoringsuperstarhero" by Jon Hare (born 1966) and Richard Joseph (1953–2007), sung by Jackie Reed, was composed for SWOS. The original song published in 1994 only had one verse, for the version of the games published in 2006 Hare wrote two more verses and he and Joseph re-recorded the song with original vocalist Jackie Reed, who also appears with the Sensible team in the introduction video to the game on some formats.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sensible_World_of_Soccer Sensible World of Soccer]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208220.name: WWF WrestleMania (1991)
208220.description:
WWF WrestleMania (named after the World Wrestling Federation's annual pay-per-view event) is a game developed by Twilight and published by Ocean Software in 1991 for the Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, and DOS. It was the first WWF licensed game available for these computers which were still dominant in Europe. It was followed on most of these computers by 1992's WWF European Rampage Tour.

In February 1993, the Spectrum version was released as part of the Super Fighter compilation with Pit-Fighter and Final Fight.

Visually, the game resembles the arcade game WWF Superstars, and it plays somewhat similarly as well.

Gameplay
The player can choose from either Hulk Hogan, The Ultimate Warrior, or The British Bulldog and must defeat five opponents to become the WWF Champion. The opponents are, in order, Mr. Perfect, The Warlord, "Million Dollar Man" Ted DiBiase, The Mountie, and Sgt. Slaughter. Before each match, the opponent will taunt the player's wrestler with a comment, and the player will then be able to choose from several replies in a nod to the WWF house style at the time.

Each wrestler is able to perform basic punches and kicks as well as a range of more advanced moves such as dropkicking, clotheslining, and one signature grapple maneuver which is performed by "waggling the joystick". In addition, there is a chair outside the ring which can be used as a weapon. Matches have a five-minute time limit, and a time limit draw or count-out will have the same effect as losing a match. The player has a total of four credits.

The game also features a practice mode in which the player faces a prone opponent. Another player can also control the second wrestler, but it will always be Mr. Perfect.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WWF_WrestleMania_%281991_video_game%29 WWF WrestleMania (1991 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208221.name: Cover Girl Strip Poker
208221.description:
User Summary
Strip Poker game with eight real models:
Maria Whittaker, Amanda Godden, Ginny Champ, Donna Ewin, Trine Michelsen (1966-2009), Sofia Bratlund, Jane, Signe Andersen.

The game is straight forward poker; when you take the girls to the cleaners you will get a small animation of her undressing (time laps stills) and the game continues.

208222.name: 10 Useful Maps Vol. 1
208222.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

'10 useful maps #01' consists of maps and handouts of various typical fantasy locations.

Each map from the set provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure for one evening play. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

208223.name: 10 Useful Maps Vol. 2
208223.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

'10 useful maps #02' consists of maps and handouts of various typical fantasy locations.

Each map from the set provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure for one evening play. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

208224.name: Gravity Force
208224.description:
Gravity Force is a computer game released in 1989 for the Amiga by Kingsoft GmbH. It is a 2D Thrust-clone, with single player missions and a 2-player multiplayer mode. It is primarily notable for inspiring the far more popular unofficial sequel Gravity Force 2.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gravity_Force Gravity Force]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary
All work (coding, graphics and music) by Stephan Wenzler

208225.name: Gravity Force 2
208225.description:
In 1994, Jens Andersson and Jan Kronqvist released Gravity Force 2 in both freeware and registered shareware versions. Innovative split-screen and serial-cable multiplayer modes resulted in a fast-paced dogfight mode and great replayability value. In 1995, the games magazine, Amiga Power, declared Gravity Force 2 the second best Amiga game of all time (behind Sensible Soccer) which resulted in great exposure for a freeware/shareware title. Amiga Power then commissioned Gravity Power, a slightly enhanced version of Gravity Force 2 which was given away on the coverdisk of issue 50. In 1996, Gravity Power was subsequently declared the second best game of all time. Gravity Force 2 and Gravity Power are both now freeware.

On September 21, 2008 the developers of Gravity Force 2 released the source code for "nostalgic interest" without specified license.

A planned sequel to Gravity Force 2 to be called gf2k was being developed by the original authors but was never completed.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gravity_Force%23Gravity_Force_2 Gravity Force]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208226.name: Nitro
208226.description:
Nitro is a top-down perspective arcade racer for the Amiga and Atari ST. It was developed and published in 1990 by Psygnosis.

Gameplay

This game contains no clear background or storyline, just white-knuckle video game racing. After choosing whether to play with one, two or three (via keyboard) players, the player(s) must select a car and buy accessories at the "pit stop" before proceeding to the race. Three vehicles are available; namely the racing car, sports car, and turbo buggy. Accessories include nitros, high speed, acceleration, traction, fix damage, a change of car, as well as fuel which is imperative to the racing campaign.

The game consists of 32 levels, but the game ends when the fuel is depleted. To prevent this, the player must finish in a high place on most races, which rewards the player with up to 600 gasoline units. In addition, power-ups float around in the levels as well as being placed on the track, but these may be picked up by any of the four cars.

There are four different environments. Starting on city roads, the player advance through forest and desert tracks before playing the last levels in a wasteland terrain. (Evidently, the Nitro story is that the apocalypse occurs, and the races go on. "The end of the world is nigh" is graffitied on the track.) Every four races there are night levels, which means that the screen is pitch-black save for the small area illuminated by headlights. Double headlights are available as a floating power-up.

Obstacles during races are commonplace. Examples are cones and holes in the road, which mainly slow down the player, and (blue) oil spillage which causes the car to spin. The Nitro manual makes reference to pedestrians, and says that in some races extra points are given for hitting pedestrians—however During a replay only 1 of the 32 levels has a message prior to entering the race, mentioning: money awarded for hitting pedestrians.

Nitro was also available as part of the Psygnosis monster pack, volume I, along with the original Shadow of the Beast and Infestation. The "monsters" in the game may refer to the players — namely, Clint Eastwood (P1—white), Rambo (P2—yellow), and James Bond (P3—red).

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nitro_%28video_game%29 Nitro (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208227.name: Santa's Xmas Capers (Amstrad/Commodore/ZX)
208227.description:
User Summary
Side scrolling shoot 'em up for 8-bit computers. Play as Santa and shoot down bad things while you pick up the presents...

Also titled as Santa's Christmas Capers simutaniously as Santa's Xmas Caper

208228.name: Santa's Xmas Caper (Amiga)
208228.description:
User Summary
Platform game where you play as Santa to collect all the pressents that he lost, and is now scattered over the world.

Not to be confused with Zeppelin's OTHER game of the same name!
Just like the previous game, this one have name inconsistency:
Box and splash: Santa's Xmas Caper
Diskette: Santa's Christmas Caper

208229.name: The Big Red Adventure
208229.description:
The Big Red Adventure (TBRA) is a PC adventure game, created in 1995 by Paolo Costabel for Dynabyte and published by Core Design. It was released for the Amiga A1200 and A4000 (AGA) in 1997 by Power Computing on CD-ROM.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Big_Red_Adventure The Big Red Adventure]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208230.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 6, Issue 9 - Day at the Office)
208230.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This Week: We have a great new adventure for your heroes, so join the fun.

208231.name: New Villains: Exemplar
208231.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the superheroes of the world disappeared, they left behind sidekicks and pupils, potential heroes waiting for their chance. One such student, Exemplar, decided to take matters into his own hands after Ragnarok. He fights other base raiders, the government, and anyone else who stands in his way. His self-righteousness makes him a dangerous foe because he believes he is the only true hero left in the world. Everyone else is a villain or a misguided fool.

Exemplar's parents are incredibly wealthy though and want to hire base raiders to capture him before he goes too far. Canny PCs can make quite a bit of loot by taking down this dangerous base raider.

This PDF contains Exemplar's back story, full stats, and advice on how to use him in your game.

208232.name: Archetypes of Nyarlathotep
208232.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Evil With Many Faces!

The eldritch, the strange, and the weird are often relegated to the domains of villains and NPCs in fantasy, with the good guys being the ones who stand in the way of the dark things that remain just beyond our perception, which we can never truly understand. But sometimes, it can be fun to take on the mantle of the otherworldly, and to embrace the alien terrors of the cosmos. Each installment of Weekly Wonders: Eldritch Archetypes contains five archetypes for eldritch characters—those that are weird, alien, and otherworldly, who don’t fit in with normal society—as well as a cleric domain devoted to a specific mythos entity or race.

This particular installment focuses on the various avatars and incarnations of the mysterious entity known as Nyarlathotep. Described in numerous different, and sometimes contradictory, fashions by a variety of authors, the only constant that seems to apply to Nyarlathotep is its malevolent interest in mortal affairs. Each of the archetypes in this book is patterned off of one of Nyarlathotep’s many avatars, aspects, or forms. This book contains the following archetypes:

The dark pharaoh, an mesmerist archetype that can deliver pharaonic curses to his foes, an excels at controlling large crowds.
The lurker in darkness, a rogue archetype who gains a variety of supernatural powers from darkness, including increased combat capabilities and a defensive shroud of shadows.
The skintaker, a slayer archetype that can wear the skins of its foes to create supernatural disguises, animate severed skins into servitor minions, and much more.
The disciple of the black book, a witch archetype focused on deceiving her foes through disguising her spells and manipulating enemies into doing her bidding unknowingly.
The master of many faces, a wizard archetype specializing in polymorph spells, allowing them to adopt as many personas as Nyarlathotep itself.
A bonus cleric domain devoted to those who worship Nyarlathotep.

208233.name: Kung-Fu Kuma: The Cycle of Revenge
208233.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cycle of Revenge is a cinematic adventure for the Kung Fu Kuma campaign world and the Pathfinder Game System ™. It is an adventure for 4-6 adventurers of 2nd to 3rd level. The adventure is designed for 4 characters of 3rd level. If more characters are involved, then some of the characters should be 2nd level. As always, though, an easier or harder game can be implemented by altering the difficulty of the encounters, or simply by adjusting the levels of the characters.

208234.name: Plains of Rust
208234.description:
From publisher blurb:

The once glittering glass and steel towers of the City of Dreams have fallen into disrepair and neglect. Thousands upon thousands of skyscrapers, dominating the horizon, their steel slowly turning to rust and decay, which the wind picks up and sends cascading down upon the plains in huge clouds, covering everything in flakes of red. To reach the City of Dreams, one must first cross those rust-filled plains. It is a dangerous and hard land, and the City of Dreams beyond it even more so.
