Yet, it is rumored that just beyond the City of Dreams there is a land that has not been laid to waste. For some, the hope of such a place is all they have left.

208235.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (September 2016)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Curses to Encounter in a Necropolis
20 Minor Hauntings to Encounter in an Ancient Necropolis
208235.description:
From publisher blurb:

This month’s issue features:

20 Curses to Encounter in a Necropolis
Shroudhaven at a Glance (from Village Backdrop: Shroudhaven)
Godswatch at a Glace (from Places of Power: Godswatch)
Flenheim at a Glance (from Subterranean Enclave: Flenheim)
20 Minor Hauntings to Encounter in an Ancient Necropolis

208236.name: Cross Roads
208236.description: All the ants want to return to their home in Cross Roads, so they jostle back and forth among the other crawling critters, but the way home isn't easy because if a strong scent crosses your path, you'll fall back and lose valuable time.

208237.name: 100 Things to Find at Farmers' Markets and Craft Fairs
208237.description:
This is a modern list of items that could be found by players at events such as farmers' markets and craft fairs, or similar locations. The items include food, usually specialist or limited manufacture in some way, and hand-crafted items.

This list can be used to flesh out a location with useless items, or could be a potential source of loot following an apocalyptic event. Some items may be useful; others, not so much.

An example result:

51. Meat (Organic or more uncommon meats, including ostrich and buffalo)

- Publisher's description

208238.name: 100 More Things to Find at Farmers' Markets and Craft Fairs
208238.description:
This is a modern list of another 100 items that could be found by players at events such as farmers' markets and craft fairs, or similar locations. The items include food, usually specialist or limited manufacture in some way, and hand-crafted items.

This list can be used to flesh out a location with useless items, or could be a potential source of loot following an apocalyptic event. Some items may be useful; others, not so much.

An example result:

56. Lavender Bag (Embroidered or decorated fabric bags containing dried lavender, or possibly with other scented plants instead)

- Publisher's description

208239.name: 100 Pieces of Clutter to Find in a Container
208239.description:
This is a list of 100 different, mostly low value or worthless, but not necessarily useless, items that could be found in a random container, should players want to know exactly what is in that chest, box, crate or whatever.

The items detailed are mostly suitable for a medieval or a Renaissance-era campaign. Whilst there is a base 100 items listed, many of the items have options allowing the creation of far more than the 100.

One page of the PDF is the cover, one the front matter.

70. Pins (Bone, iron or brass pins)
71. Plate (Pewter, clay or wooden plates and platters, in different sizes)
72. Points (Ties used to fasten pieces of clothing together, made from linen, ribbon or silk thread or, more cheaply, cord or leather)

- Publisher's description

208241.name: The Dwelling of Dortho
208241.description:
From the introduction:

Dortho, a small time Derro mage, was always obsessed with creature taxidermy. He even built an illegal laboratory in his basement in order to further his research. He started to have the crazy idea of stuffing creatures before their death, so that they could be more life like. However, in a dangerous ritual he had a dire mistake.

User summary:

For 3rd - 5th level characters.

208242.name: Apocalypse Prevention, Inc. 2nd Edition QuickStart
208242.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Apocalypse Prevention, Inc. 2nd Edition QuickStart, where you can thwart catastrophes, end end-of-world scenarios and defeat of doomsday plans.

Join the fight to protect Earth by enlisting in API, a worldwide company whose only mission is to stop anyone or anything who wants to harm our world. Humanity doesn’t fight this battle alone, as monsters and demons have given up their lurking to serve the alongside the company. This is their home too!

The Apocalypse Prevention, Inc. 2nd Edition QuickStart includes the following:

Setting and Rules Summary
Intro Adventure: Blue Card Duty
10 Pregenerated Characters

208243.name: Basic Dungeon
208243.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I know exactly which way we came. It was down here..wasn't it?"
Last words of Heranal Greytooth, Level 1 Fighter

Geomorphs - Basic Dungeon is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Basic Dungeon is a geomorphic set, comprising 14 10x10 square battlemaps and 7 5x10 rectangular end-piece battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. The tiles depict a classic dungeon, with damaged flagstones, debris, winding passages and larger chambers. The 7 end-piece battlemaps are ideal for giving a natural edge to a geomorphic tile and feature stairs and ends. The tiles can be combined together in milions of ways, giving limitless unique and interesting dungeons. Just rotating a single tile can radically change the layout of a dungeon. The corridors and rooms are unfurnished, allowing you to decide exactly what's in them by using your own paper or 3D furniture.

208244.name: Tome Of Villainy
208244.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need adversaries for you Fantasy Hero campaign. Here you will find three new groups to add to your campaign. From a golem like race led by a mad wizard, an insect race killing and devouring all they find and a group of mages trying to take over the realm. All you need to keep you players on their toes.

Includes a 90 page PDF, Hero Design Files and Cardboard Miniatures

208245.name: Oleric Preene
208245.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oleric is a chaotic evil male half-orc with antipaladin levels utilizing the iron tyrant archetype (included along with progression table). He focuses on powerful defense and fights with his armor spikes and hurled javelins. His capabilities are greatly bolstered by his armor mastery feats (included) gained as bonuses as he progresses levels. These are supplemented by bonding a fiendish spirit into his armor for various arcane effects.

Product Overview

We love our fantasy villains. We find them in films, on posters, in commercials, on snack foods, and even as action figures. Our societies flirt and play with villains at a safe distance, and we adore them. That same sense of awe and wonder can be captured by a player roleplaying an evil character. It does not work for all gaming groups, but for those able to handle it, the experience can be rewarding.

This product can serve several purposes. Some game groups dabble in evil adventures as a one-shot or short run campaign. Others want to experiment with evil characters and add one or two in to see how it affects the game. Still others fully embrace evil characters and find they sometimes need replacement characters after a sudden and unexpected character death. For whatever reason you need a ready-to-play character sheet, this product is for you.

Welcome to Wicked Wanderers! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

208246.name: The Unearthed Hack
208246.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Unearthed Hack is a Collection of rules variants and extras for use with the Black Hack. Within the pages of this book are rules for character creation, character vs character combat, using non-human races, deadlier missile weapons, defensive tactics, and weaker as well as more powerful foes.

Also featured are 8 character classes, new Arcane and Divine spells, magic weapons and items, new armor types, and hirelings.

Finally, rules for including a new stat that influences Charisma, as well as level drain and an alternative "Out of Action" table with variable outcomes based upon damage type, and... a new character sheet are also included.

208247.name: The Hidden Oak (5E)
208247.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tangible Taverns: The Hidden Oak is a shelter for weary travellers, a gathering place for forest denizens, and a refuge for creatures shunned by their brethren.

The tavern, tucked away in the woods and located in the ground beneath a giant fir tree, welcomes creatures of all types. The food is varied (and occasionally has short term-benefits beyond filling the stomach of the consumer), the rooms unusual but comfortable, the guests memorable, and the book and game collections extensive. If your PCs are fortunate enough to find The Hidden Oak, they are unlikely to forget such a magical place.

This PDF includes rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and descriptions of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities, as well as a few stat blocks).

208248.name: Lady Satan 2004
208248.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Lord Satan is not yet satisfied, my dear..."

Ever since he was cast down from Heaven, Satan has been fighting to get his revenge. Not content with merely gathering souls for the fires of Hell, he has tried many ways to gain access to Earth and spread more corruption. Among those ways is to create offspring with mortal women. This latest rekease from NUELOW Games deals with that topic.

Lady Satan 2004 contains a chilling tale by Marv Wolfman (with art by Ross Andru & Mike Esposito) of Satan and one of his children on Earth, and all-new rules material and adventure hooks for d20 System games (such as d20 Modern and Pathfinder) by Steve Miller that will let gamers play Offspring of Satan who ether embrace their dark heritage or fight against it.

208249.name: Kapro Dynamics: Cornus Aero-Fighters
208249.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thank you for your interest in Kapro Dynamics! Our latest entries from the Cornus Aerospace Fighter line are ready for purchase.

The Cornus line are sturdy and reliable star fighters that allow you to take the fight to the enemy without making your bank account a battlefield.

The Cornus line includes:

Statistics and descriptions of the fighters, compatible for White Star!
New, must-have equipment for pilots who do more than take flight.
Pilot Friendly campaign styles as well as detailed plot hooks to get your pilots into the action.

208250.name: Taking on the Dead - New Cleric Archetypes
208250.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces three new cleric archetypes that focus on taking the fight to undead. The ghost hunter learns how to harness his ability to channel energy in enhancing his weapons and armor to deal with the incorporeal threats. The Undead Hunter hearkens back to an older version of the cleric, not only using her channel energy to turn undead, but even destroying them at higher levels. The vampire hunter uses her faith to empower her ability to take on those blood-thirsty undead predators. A new domain and spell are also included in this issue as well.

208251.name: Ancient Necropolis
208251.description:
From publisher blurb:

20 Things #6: Ancient Necropolis comprises the following 20 Things articles, along with other supplementary material:

10 Things to Loot from a Tomb Robber’s Body
20 Curses to Encounter in a Necropolis
20 Minor Hauntings to Encounter in an Ancient Necropolis
20 Things to Find in a Dusty Crypt
20 Things to Find in a Sarcophagus
20 Things to Find in an Ancient Necropolis

208252.name: SD Gundam G Generation Genesis
208252.description:
User Summary

SD Gundam G Generation Genesis is a Strategy game.

208253.name: Megami Meguri
videogamehonor: 2016 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
208253.description:
User Summary

Megami Meguri is an Action Adventure game.

208254.name: Monster Hunter Spirits
208254.description:
User Summary

Monster Hunter Spirits is a spin-off card game.

208255.name: Sengoku Basara: Sanada Yukimura-Den
208255.description:
User Summary

Sengoku Basara: Sanada Yukimura-Den is an Action game.

208256.description:
Description from the publisher:

The fairy tales collected by the Brothers Grimm are full of magic, deception, and violence — sounds perfect for Munchkin! Iconic baddies and boons, like evil stepmothers and Rapunzel's golden locks, are captured in 120 cards in Munchkin Grimm Tidings, a standalone Munchkin game with new art by John Kovalic.
208256.name: Munchkin Grimm Tidings

208257.name: Toraware no Palm
208257.description:
User Summary

Toraware no Palm is an adventure game.

208258.name: Hey! Pikmin
208258.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Captain Olimar has crashed on an unknown planet inhabited by Pikmin!And his first 2D platformer will give you a new perspective on his adorably fierce partners. Touch the screen to throw Pikmin into action: swim with Blue Pikmin, fly with Winged Pikmin, and more to survive hostile wildlife, solve ecological puzzles, and escape!

Help Captain Olimar explore and escape a new world by guiding him and his Pikmin with the stylus
Olimar is a half-pint Hero on a personal mission to save himself
Get a new perspective on the powers and personalities of Pikmin
Tap the touchscreen to choose Pikmin and toss them at objects or enemies

Source: The Publisher Website.

208259.description:
Game description from the publisher:

This (2016) is a very special year for GRANNA - we are celebrating our 25th anniversary! Throughout all this time we have tried to provide all of you with the best games - the kind we would like to play ourselves. We would like you to celebrate this very special anniversary together with us. For this occasion we have prepared a little surprise. Open the box and enter the land of good games. Thank you for being with us!

The game 25 consists of a deck of 54 double-faced cards. They show pieces of the covers of 6 games published by Granna. Each cover picture is divided into 6 pieces. Each card's 2 sides show pieces from the same position of 2 different cover pictures. Each specific piece of a cover appears on 3 different cards in the deck. In a 2-player game, the goal is to make 2 complete pictures on the table. With 3 and 4 players, the goal is to make 1 complete picture on the table and collect 1 piece each of the 5 other pictures.

208260.name: Stat Manipulation
208260.description:
From publisher blurb:

These feats give you a way to manipulate the bonuses your stats, also called ability scores, give you. But, as with many things, they come with a penalty, as you can only push the body and mind so far…

Features

Common rules for the use of these feats
7 new base feats that can be customised and tweaked each time you take one. You can expand the effect it has, reduces the penalty it gives you or even increase the number of times it can be used per day
Each base feat has its own version tied to a different stat - For example,if you have "Astounding Strength" you don't get the benefit of "Astounding Dexterity". One feat has 30 possible variations to choose from.




The base feats you'll find inside -
(X) & (Y) are replaced with the names of the stats being manipulated by the feat.

Astounding (X) - Re-roll any dice roll related to this stat
Bonus Swap (X) (Y) - Swap the bonus you get from one stat with another
Incredible (X) - Add a second bonus to the one gained from this stat
Infused (X) - Sacrifice a spell to give a stat a boost
Opposing (X) - Use your stat bonus to reduce or negate another beings bonus
Strain (X) - Strain your body and mind for greater effects, but at a price
Transfer Bonus (x) - Use your bonus to aid another

208261.name: Of Banishment & Blight (5E)
208261.description:
From publisher blurb:

Atop a cursed mountain, in towers of ice and snow is a danger of primordial origin - the Lord of Frost. From his frozen keep he threatens the lands and peoples in the shadow of his mountain, bringing low all who come too near. Help is needed to break his hold on the land and end his reign before his power reaches beyond the mountain itself.

The bold know no rest!

A mid-level adventure for a party of 3-6 characters. Play as stand-alone or part of a larger series.

208262.name: Stolen Lives
208262.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Victims of the Demon Lord

A people created by magic, changelings can alter their physical form to adopt the characteristics of any living person they can see. Stolen Lives builds on the information presented in Shadow of the Demon Lord by providing you with 16 killer pages loaded with new lore, tools for developing intricate background and personality details, and a new expert path that amplifies the changeling's already potent abilities. Written by Robert J. Schwalb and illustrated by Svetloslav Petrov, this is a perfect supplement for anyone interested in changelings and fitting them into their worlds.

208263.name: Apokalypse
208263.description:
Apokalypse was a miniature wargame set in a dystopian future, the aftermath of the final war. It simulated the desperate skirmishes, firefights and encounters taking place in the last 120 days of humanity. The players took the role of powermongers, leaders and warlords of what armed forces still existing in the postapocalyptic wasteland, using remaining survivors as tools to enforce their agenda.

It was stated Apokalypse used 25mm miniatures but since that scale later came to be known as (non-heroic) 28mm you could generally say that 28mm is the default standard for the game. The length measure unit, "meters", was intentionally meant for being adapted to whatever scale of minis you had access to, making the game playable with all scales of miniatures.

When Hardcore Media was liquidated, around 1998-99, the game faded into obscurity and very much stayed that way.
In 2016 it was made available online, as a freeware document with the creators' consent, through a fan-made PDF of the original rulebook (available in the Web Links section).

There were occasional references to expansions throughout the core rulebook. The material for all of these was sadly destroyed when Hardcore Media folded and its creators moved on to different projects. Apokalypse was a fully finished product and contains all the rules and information needed to play, despite this.

208265.name: Sisyphus Reborn
208265.description:
User Summary

A short atmospheric adventure game about finding meaning in a meaningless world.

208266.name: The Garden
208266.description:
The Garden is a retro-style action role-playing game about young John Marshall on and epic quest to find his family. You'll meet both friends and enemies, aquire powerful new weapons and abilities, as you fight your way thourgh this story-driven adventure!

Source: The Developer Website.

208267.name: Intensive Exposure
208267.description:
Intensive Exposure is a fast paced game in which you have to expose yourself as many times as possible without getting caught by security.

Source: The Game Website.

208270.name: Just Sing
208270.description:
Just Sing is unlike more traditional karaoke and music games for consoles in that it does not come with a USB microphone. Instead, players will connect their smartphones to the game using an app, and then they can hold it out in front of them like they are taking a selfie.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Just_Sing Just Sing]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208271.name: Het Stratégisch Spel, Of Militaire Uitspanning
boardgamepublisher: De Weduwe J. Allart en Comp
208271.description:
Wargame published in the Netherlands and Germany in 1819 for teaching military strategy. It was sold in a wooden box containing a rulebook, 2 dice, 52 rectangular wooden playing pieces representing military units, and an 18.5 inches square topographic map.

Units move from crossroad to crossroad on the point-to-point map. Terrain affects unit movement and combat, and players also need to use their mobile magazines to provide supply for their army. The goal of the game is to capture the enemy capital. A player can also win by surrounding or eliminating a large enough portion of the enemy army.

Combat is mostly deterministic with rules for how many of different types of units are required to successfully attack a position, modified by map terrain, but players under some circumstances roll the dice to resolve combats.

208272.name: Karma. Incarnation 1
208272.description:
Classical 2D point-n-click psychedelic adventure, permeated with original humor and mind blowing puzzles.

Source: The Game Website.

208274.name: Ship Files: RAX Type Protected Merchant
208274.description:
From publisher blurb:

The trade routes of known space can be dangerous, even with the presence of security forces and local law enforcement. The RAX is a well armoured and armed merchant, which affords more protection and security, which is especially important when carrying expensive cargo. Even more dangerous are the routes out on the frontier, fortunately this vessel is well equipped to look after itself if need be.

This book details the RAX Protected Merchant. It is designed to fit into any setting and is an ideal ship for players and referees alike.

Features:

Brief Description of the interior
Deckplans
Game Specs
Play Sheets
Colour Plates of serveral notable vessels
Blue Prints

208275.name: Plague of Paucity
208275.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure set in the Last Kingdom for four characters of 2nd level.

The mountainous lands of the Last Kingdom have long been home to dangerous oni and their foul servitors and kin, but the unification of the Saigoto under the enlightened rulership of the Five Truths has sent them scurrying back into darkness. For years since, they have kept the land shielded from harm. Yet even the great soldiers garrisoned across the Kingdom’s shores and roads cannot stop dissent from boiling up in the shadows. Not everyone embraces the edicts of the land—and while patient teachers, even the Five Truths have their limits. As growing numbers of lastfolk begin to question the traditions of the Last Kingdom, forces far more sinister, preying on the curiosities of mortals, have begun to emerge into the light...

Can the PCs discover and end a treacherous plot that threatens to destroy the relative peace of the Last Kingdom?

208276.name: Inquisitor Orisons (PRD)
208276.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Inquisitor Spells is a simple document that collects the inquisitor spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level inquisitor spells (orisons).

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208277.name: Starly Girls: Episode Starsia
208277.description:
User Summary

The player takes on the role of the captain of a space ship called “Asterism,” and they’ll explore the vast outer-space together with crew mates called “Star Girls.”

208278.name: Inquisitor Orisons (3PP)
208278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Inquisitor Spells is a simple document that collects the inquisitor spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level inquisitor spells (orisons).

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and from select third-party products.

208279.name: Witch Spells I (3PP)
208279.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level witch spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208280.name: Witch Spells I (PRD)
208280.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level witch spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208281.name: Alchemist Extracts I (PRD)
208281.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Alchemist Extracts is a simple document that collects the alchemist extractlist, and all extracts in it, for easy use. The extract lists are broken up by level and school, and the extracts of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level alchemist extracts.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208282.name: Alchemist Extracts I (3PP)
208282.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Alchemist Extracts is a simple document that collects the alchemist extractlist, and all extracts in it, for easy use. The extract lists are broken up by level and school, and the extracts of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level alchemist extracts.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208283.name: World of Kos
rpgsetting: Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting
208283.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the “World of Kos,” the sixth volume of the Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting! This book provides an overview of the campaign setting and of how it came to be and provides a framework for the first five volumes, “Kos City,” “Kos Island,” “Lands Beyond Kos,” “Lives of Kos,” and “Encounters,” and can be used either in conjunction with them or on its own.

This book contains:

Maps of Kos Island, the Aegean, and the Mediterranean.
An overview of the world, the impact upon it of the Great Cataclysm, and a timeline.
A section on Deities and Religion and the ongoing war between the Olympian Gods and the primordial Titans.
A section on 17 races native to the world of Kos, including Antaeans, Arachneans, Cynocephalians, Island Gnomes, and Myrmidons.
A section on Monsters and their roles in the world of Kos.
Sections on Languages, Clothing, Wealth & Money, Entertainment, Military Organizations, and Adventurer Culture.




The Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting has deliberately been designed to be system free, not tied to any particular game setting, and to be compatible with any set of role-playing game rules suitable for ancient, medieval, or fantasy venues. In that the setting was used as the playtest backdrop for games using the OGL/d20, Pathfinder, “Basic” Dungeons & Dragons and Labyrinth Lord retroclone, and Advanced Dungeons & Dragons rules, of course, it is an especially ideal setting for them.

208284.name: Scratch Wars
208284.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Scratch Wars is close to a collectible game, but in certain game modes it's closer to a board game and can be also played online through a phone application for iOS and Android.

In more detail, to start playing Scratch Wars you need only two cards: one hero and one weapon. The cards are unique in several aspects. You can scratch them like lottery tickets, but by doing so you are not destroying or devaluing them. Each hero card is unique; each hero has a unique name and value generated. No one else in the world will have the same card! Slowly uncover the card by scratching it and in combination with unique values, it is pleasantly thrilling. Cards can even be bought individually. (Would you rather a hero or a weapon?)

With an increasing number of weapon cards, you can try a sophisticated one-on-one duel in which you equip your hero with up to five weapons, then think strategically to find out which one to use when. The duel itself is very interesting; you spin a special circular weapon: turntable paper on a stick. The hero has certain levels of energy which you spend using various weapons. Heroes can change weapons during the turn and their proper use is the focus of the game. The game is risk management; you are trying to spend the hero's energy for the best possible effects. According to the composition of effects, you choose weapon, strategy and risk. You can attack the opponent's weapon, his permanent effects, or the hero directly. You have to decide when to repair a weapon, when to save energy for the hit with more powerful weapons, etc.

Once you get into the basic game, you can try a more comprehensive and strategic mode in which teams of heroes compete against each other. Then you can move to the top mode where entire armies of heroes collide. With more than two players, it is possible to play in teams or each player plays by themselves with modified rules. The game is perfect for tournaments.

If you want to play with just one player, simply scan the card into your phone and you can play online. There is a varied range of options at your disposal, from tournaments and hero trainings to territorial fights. The goal is to level your hero up and obtain spells for him. As the first game in the world, Scratch Wars presents digital ownership so that what you have physically, you also have digitally. If you later want to replace or sell any of your heroes, you can change them digitally with all that is recorded on the card, i.e., with all the spells and experiences.

If you would rather play the game more as a board game and add more strategic options, you will be able to expand the game with "trade" cards or hero's "abilities".

208285.name: A Facsimile of Death
208285.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Facsimile of Death is meant as an introduction to the world of Interface Zero, as well as to the Fate Core version of the game. There are some firefights, but most of the adventure involves investigation, planning, social navigation, and trying hard not to be betrayed. It’s the story of Avery Price, a murder victim with nobody to look into her death … until the PCs come along.

A Facsimile of Death uses a set of extra rules called the Whodunit System. In this adventure, there are four potential murderers, and any one of them could have done the deed. You, the GM, will figure out who the killer is along with the PCs, and the adventure will adapt to their choices.

In the end, though, nothing is ever really what it seems.

208286.name: Villains & Vigilantes: Mighty Protectors (3rd Editon)
208286.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

The new 'third edition' has a name, and not just a number: it’s called MIGHTY PROTECTORS™ after the player group from the very first V&V campaign in our official setting – the Mighty Protectors Multiverse.

Mighty Protectors features a new streamlined and expanded revision of the V&V rules, an intro to the Mighty Protectors Multiverse (about which we've only provided scattered details before), and all-new artwork.

208287.name: Seduction
208287.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wanted more story in your roleplaying game stories?

Story Design Volume 10 - A seduction story has the protagonist trying to avoid doing something they know they aren’t supposed to do. It could be lying, cheating, stealing, breaking an oath, succumbing to addiction, or anything that has serious consequences. The thing that the protagonist is seduced by is referred to as the object of desire. This plot is almost wholly character-driven.

Examples of the seduction plot include Doctor Faustus, The Last Temptation of Christ, Lolita, The Lord of the Rings, and The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde.

Story Design: The Seduction covers all of the elements you need to prepare in order to tell a temptation story.

208288.name: Steampunk Street Name Generator
208288.description:
This is a simple generator intended to help a GameMaster quickly generate steampunk-themed names in an urban area for a previously unnamed street, whether this is in advance when designing a town or city, or on the fly, should the players suddenly need to know a street name.

The supplement consists of two tables. The first table has 50 descriptive names that can be used; the second has 30 different street types. To generate a name, simply roll on both tables to create one, or select appropriate results manually. There are hundreds of potential steampunk-themed names that can be generated, especially when plurals and possessives are used with the first table.

The supplement has three pages; the first is the cover, the second the front matter and instructions and the third is the two tables.

An example result generated using the tables would be Observatory Mews.

- Publisher's description

208289.name: Mighty Protectors Referee Screen
208289.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

Printable 8 page landscape-format PDF of all of the crucial lists and charts from the new game.

208290.name: Market Forces
208290.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

An investigation into local organized crime turns out to have international ties!

208291.name: War Heroes
208291.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

Seventy characters, period vehicles and equipment, maps, a timeline, and optional rules for an ultra-low-powered Commandos campaign. Team up with Freedom Eagle, Psi-Man, and Stormlord's father, Excalibur!

208292.name: Situation Room
208292.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

Seventy characters, period vehicles and equipment, maps, a timeline, and optional rules for an ultra-low-powered Commandos campaign. Team up with Freedom Eagle, Psi-Man, and Stormlord's father, Excalibur!

208293.name: Count Shadau
208293.description:
From publisher blurb:

EVIL FROM THE DARKEST CORNER OF EUROPE! Deep in the heart of Romania, where empires have clashed for ages and many powers have left their traces, a corruption is growing. A master of dark arts and in possession of a relic of stunning power, Count Shadau’s web of in influence and allies reaches out its tendrils, planning first to seize Romania. As turmoil and fascist strains slither through Europe, he will take power wherever he can and weave his vision of Greater Romanian domination of the continent under his rule as Emperor. His secret grip tightens... and the world cries out!

208294.name: Dr. Killjoy & Spoilsport Foe File
208294.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

Meet the murderous doctor and his violent kid sidekick!

208295.name: Rolla Girlz Gang Guide
208295.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

Thugs for hire, perfect for street-level campaigns or as henchmen to a more powerful supervillain!

208296.name: Excel Record Sheet Pack for Mighty Protectors
208296.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

Character, Vehicle, Group & Combat record sheets. Speeds up character creation and gameplay!

208297.name: The Gongfarmer's Almanac (Volume 6 - Aug 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
208297.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here is the Table of Contents for Volume #6:

Volume RULES & CAMPAIGN MISCELLANY – PART III

Dedicate Reliquary 4
Demon’s Conscripts, The (a mid-level adventure) 12
It’s Only A Flesh Wound 27
Johnny Appleseed – Patron 31
Virtual Funnel, The 44
0-Level Player Character Record Sheet

208298.name: Aetaltis Bestiary Collection: Trench Crawler
208298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trench crawlers creep along reefs and the rocky walls of deep sea trenches in search of their next meal. Once they locate good hunting grounds, they secure their hooks in small crevices and lay flat against the trench wall. Keeping at least one hook buried in the wall, it lashes out with the other hooks with lightning speed and deadly accuracy. Once its victim is impaled, it is extremely difficult for the creature to pull away, leaving the trench crawler to simply wait for its prey to exhaust itself or die from blood loss. Make your players regret their decision to go into the water with this deadly new monster!

208299.name: Flipped Off!
208299.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Flipped Off is a tactical card game where you play a plotting Mastermind aiming to defeat your rivals and seize control of the city for yourself. You must manage your Minions - the Pirates, Ninjas, and Robots that do your bidding, play actions that can improve your situation or wreak havoc with your enemies, and use your Minions to launch attacks and hope that your rivals can’t turn the cascade of results to their own advantage.

Each player has a set of Minion cards that they can use to attack other players, and a set of Action cards in their hand that they can use to affect either their own minions, or other player's minions. The objective of the game is to use your Minions and Actions to attack the other players and reduce their health until only a single player remains.

A Minion attacks by triggering another active Minion on the board. When a Minion is triggered it has an effect - it can deal damage to players, it can heal a player, or it can add flip counters to another Minion. But be careful! Attacking a Minion can cause a chain reaction that is out of your control. Each Minion has 2 different effects on either side of its card - each time it triggers it has a different effect on the game, and then it flips to reveal the opposite side. Minions also have a limited number of flips, once they're spent they are removed from play.

Can you out-think your opponents? Can you take advantage of the Minions on the board in order to come out on top? Eliminate your rivals and seize control of the city. Or at the very least, take all your rivals out with you and have the strongest army of Minions left who can secure the city for your successor.

208300.description: The Imperator module provides a new action location to the game. Your aim is to capture one of the 5 regions, thereby gaining a reward at the end of the round.
208300.name: Ave Roma: IMPERATOR expansion

208301.description: The Consul expansion adds a new card action location to the game. There is a new type of card to be purchased and a new resource, gold is introduced.
208301.name: Ave Roma: CONSUL expansion

208302.description: If you decide to use this module with the game, remove the area scoring card from the game. The scoring of areas is changed, and in addition you can gain different rewards.
208302.name: Ave Roma: PREATOR expansion

208303.description: Magistratus gives each player a special ability that he/she has throughout the current game. Before the beginning of the game, shuffle all the cards and hand out two to each player. Each player should keep one, the other one goes back to the game box. Choose a side on the selected card and place it in front of you, next to your player board. Proceed with the game setup as described in the rulebook.
208303.name: Ave Roma: MAGISTRATUS expansion

208304.description: Using these scoring cards, you are entering a mini race with each other in every round. Shuffle the cards at the start of the game (since they are double sided, you may want to randomize sides too) and draw all cards, placing them right to left half covering each other. The left card will be the one used for scoring the current round, while the one underneath/right to it will be used in the next round.
208304.name: Ave Roma: CENSOR expansion

208305.description:
Promo Destiny Card for Champions of Midgard.

"Have the most BLAME at the end of the game"
208305.name: Champions of Midgard: Despised Promo Card

208306.name: Samurai Warriors: Spirit of Sanada
208306.description:
It is a spin-off of Samurai Warriors 4, part of the Samurai Warriors series, which in turn is a spin-off of the long-running Dynasty Warriors series, both of which are also hack and slash games.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samurai_Warriors%3A_Sanada_Maru Samurai Warriors: Sanada Maru]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208307.name: One Million Person Nobunaga's Ambition
208307.description:
User Summary

Players simply tap the touch screen (smartphones) or use the left-mouse button (PCs) to confirm their commands in the game. The game is played in real time, and timers are needed for nearly every action in the game.

208308.name: Berserk and the Band of the Hawk
208308.description:
The game follows the story of the manga series, starting in the Golden Age Arc and ending in the Hawk of the Millennium Empire Arc.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berserk_%28video_game%29 Berserk (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208309.name: Nobunaga's Ambition: Sphere of Influence – Ascension
208309.description:
User Summary

Nobunaga’s Ambition: Sphere of Influence Sengoku Risshiden, is a followup to last year’s Nobunaga’s Ambition: Sphere of Influence.

208310.name: Careers for Kislevites
208310.description:
User summary:

Presents several basic and advanced careers for characters from the geographic region of Kislev. Basic careers include: Bear Tamer, Druzhina, Horse Archer, and Streltsi. Advanced careers include: Gryphon Legion Lancer, Kislevite Ranger, and Winged Lancer.

208311.name: Trials and Retribution
208311.description:
User summary:

Trials and Retribution is a comparatively simple ‘whodunit’ style adventure intended for players in their first careers. Set in the small monastery of Eggerswald, on the banks of the river Egger in southern Talabecland, this scenario mostly dispenses with combat, though this is still possible if the players wish, in favour of brainpower and imagination. Intended to be played as either a ‘one-off diversion’ for PCs on the road within another campaign or as a ‘stand-alone’ adventure in its own right...

208312.name: Last Call!
208312.description:
From the Game Box

THE TIME: 2:00 am
THE PLACE: downtown at the Last Call! lounge

YOU'VE SLAMMED 'EM DOWN... NOW SERVE 'EM UP!

Sure, we know. You think you're a real master of mixology--the Kahuna of Cocktails, the Baron of Blotto, the Sultan of Swill. But just because you're prayed to the porcelain god doesn't mean you have what it takes to serve its disciples. For a challenge that's straight-up and over-the-top, slip behind the bar at the Last Call! lounge--the one place where everyone can't get enough of what you've got. And since liquor is quicker, you'll feel the need for speed, because the more you accurately pour, the higher your customers--and your tips--become. And if you earn enough tips, you'll make it to last call and ride the stale ether of your liquor-soaked lounge all the way to bartender's heaven.

Now, don't fret if you don't know your Woo Woo from your Sweet Patootie, everything you need will be at your fingertips. But if you start botching up Bocci Balls or defiling Bahama Mamas, your hard-ass boss will put your butt in a Singapore Sling. So shake your thang, pour on the charm, or stir things up... whatever it takes to keep this outrageously entertaining convergence of carousers coming back for more.

HERE ARE YOUR TOOLS:


Recipes for more than 100 drinks--some of which you may want to try yourself.
Free drink tickets: no, they're not free to the bar, so don't try to be everybody's best bud.
The Music Button: you call the tune! Just be sure you're creating the right mood.
The Charm Button: if you've got it, flaunt it.
The Bounce Button: your last resort... bounce 'em before they bounce you.


And remember, at the Last Call!, you call the shots--so don't pour 'til you see the whites of their eyes (any other color and they're probably already schnookered).

208314.name: RunGunJumpGun
208314.description:
RunGunJumpGun is a tough as nails game that puts a gravity-defying weapon in your hands. One button lets you fly, the other blasts obstacles out of the way. With a cast of crazed characters, challenging gameplay, and a pulsing musical score, it delivers twitchy platforming goodness.

Source: The Game Website.

208315.name: A Comprehensive Guide to Old World Rat Catchers
208315.description:
User summary:

This booklet presents a variety of topical information derived from a variety of published rule books, supplements, and periodicals for the game. While sources are cited, full credits are not included.

Note the PDF is formatted "two-up" for booklet printing. The PDF has 8 pages; a printed and folded booklet would have 16 pages.

208316.name: 3UP 3DOWN
208316.description:
3UP 3DOWN is a fast-paced, family-friendly discard game with a surprising finish!

THE GOAL: Get rid of your cards before your family and friends can get rid of theirs.

THE SURPRISE: Three of your cards are not revealed until the very end - so you will need both strategy and luck!

And, since 3UP 3DOWN takes just 3 minutes to learn & 10 minutes to play, it's so fast and fun, you'll all say, "Let's Play Another Round!"

208317.name: The Eye of Sigmar
208317.description:
From the introduction:

The scenario is meant for a one-night game in which a group of relatively experienced players will encounter an eccentric group of NPCs. Although the scenario is meant for PCs that are in or near their second career, it can easily be tailored to make it easier or more challenging.

208319.name: The Fall: Part 2 – Unbound
208319.description:
After the unhinging events of part 1, ARID’s very existence is threatened when she is ejected from her body and projected onto a vast global network. In a desperate attempt to save herself, ARID invades and attempts to control several other robots she finds there, each with different personalities and gameplay styles. Will ARID successfully enlist their help before it’s too late? One thing’s for certain – the process will change her.

Source: The Developer Website.

208320.name: Toukiden: Mononofu
208320.description:
User Summary

A free-to-play game with item micro-transactions.

208321.description: HoldFast Atlantic recreates the ship battles contesting control of the Atlantic Ocean during World War II. The navies of Britain and the United States are challenged to keep sea lanes open for its convoys. German U-Boats prowl these waters and German and Italian battleships and cruisers threaten the sea supply lines of the Allies. The great Axis warships Bismarck, Tirpitz and others contest Britain's best while the United States fleet adds its might to the fight as the war progresses. As the Axis player can you cut the sea lanes that supply Great Britain and Russia to win the war? Or as the Allied player, can you overcome the U-Boat menace and Axis naval and air forces to control the Atlantic.
208321.name: Holdfast: Atlantic 1939-45

208322.name: Yakuza 6
videogamehonor: 2016 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
208322.description:
Yakuza 6 is an open world action-adventure game and will be similar to that of other yakuza titles with exploration mixed with arcade style over the top combat.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ry%C5%AB_ga_Gotoku_6 Ryū ga Gotoku 6]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208323.description: HoldFast Pacific has the empire of Japan attempt to control the vast Pacific Ocean. After devastating the United States fleet at Pearl Harbor, the Japanese naval, air and land forces push their conquest across the Pacific. Their only obstacles are weakened Allied forces and time as the Allies recover. Can you as the Japanese player secure a Pacific empire that protects your homeland from your enemies? And as the Allied player can you rebuild your armed forces and mount a counter attack that prevents the Japanese expansion and bring the war to their homeland?
208323.name: Holdfast: Pacific 1941-45

208324.name: Chaos Touched Monsters
208324.description:
From the introduction:

A selection of new chaos-touched monsters to darken your game.

User summary:

Presents a variety of fan-created monsters.

208325.name: Tides of Fate
208325.description:
Tides of Fate is a nautical fantasy strategy game set in the world of Thes'lia. The game supports 2-6 players with faction vs faction and free for all variants. Strategize and coordinate with allies to defeat the opposing faction by battling ships, conquering islands and sieging capitals.

The game revolves around five major mechanics. Movement, resources, expansion, combat, and fate. These mechanics allow for numerous different strategies while offering enough probability and luck to keep players on the edge of their seat throughout the whole game.

The world is split between two factions, the Congregant and the Derelict. The Congregant are the Avarie, Lokar, and Naerath nations. They believe in a prophecy foretold by ancient priests that the gods would return and bring harmony back to the people and Thes’lia. The Derelict are the Rogand, Kondrei, and Vayunne nations. They believe the era of gods have come to an end and wish to bring Thes’lia into a new era of revolution.

These conflicting ideologies have brought much strife between the two factions. The Hallowed Isles have become the only reliable origin for resources, causing the land and oceans surrounding them to become theaters of war.

208327.name: Rage Quitter or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Flip the Table
208327.description: In Rage Quitter, each player competes in a dexterity challenge to see who can collect the most game pieces from the scattered ruins of table. On each players turn, after collecting game pieces, they will flip a table(card) from their deck with two pieces on it and try not fling them off the table. After flipping a table, the player then gets to throw a table(card) to cover up the pieces on the table, so no other player can get to them.

208328.name: Yume Nikki
208328.description:
User Summary

Yume Nikki is a freeware game created by Kikiyama made using RPGMaker 2003. The title translated to "Dream Diary", and the game follows a young girl as she dreams. The goal is to acquire all available 'Effects'; the game otherwise has no plot, and nearly the entire game is left up to speculation.

208329.name: L’osti d’jeu: Souvenir
208329.description:
Game description from the publisher (Translated):
Relive your youth. Souvenir is the second expansion for L'osti d'jeu. It makes you relive the best and the worst from the 60's to the 90's in Québec. As a bonus, 10 blank cards to write your own sillyness.

Game description from the publisher (French):

Revivez votre jeunesse! L'extension souvenir est la deuxième extension de L'osti d'jeu. Elle vous fait revivre le meilleur et le pire du Québec des années 60 à 90. En prime, 10 cartes vierges pour écrire vos propres niaiseries.

208330.name: Odell Down Under
208330.description:
The player takes on the role of a fish who in turn must eat, stay clean and avoid being eaten by predators to survive. There are several modes of gameplay. In Tournament mode, the player plays every fish in the game, starting as the tiny silver sprat and eventually reaching the great white shark. A shorter Challenge mode picks four random fish (from smallest to largest) instead. The player can choose to play any fish in Practice Mode. Finally, in Create-A-Fish the player creates their own species based on various parameters such as size and agility, which also affect the appearance of the fish. The color, special ability, and nocturnal or diurnal habits are also selected. Special moves, also present for some 'real' fish, include the stingray's sting and the cuttlefish's ink squirt.
Each fish has different preferences for food, as described in the educational summary before the game starts. The game consists of nine screens, arranged in three levels from the sandy bottom to the reef's top, that various fish, including the player, move through looking for food. To survive, or to gain enough points to reach the next fish, your fish has to find enough edible food (which can include plants, crustaceans or coral as well as fish) to prevent its constantly decreasing energy bar from reaching 0 and death. The other main concern, besides avoiding predators, is health, which can only be repaired by finding a bluestreak cleaner wrasse while playing as a diurnal fish, or a banded coral shrimp while playing as a nocturnal fish, and moving next to it. Health takes a serious drop if the fish eats something poisonous to it, often a sea slug or sponge.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odell_Down_Under Odell Down Under]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208331.name: Spiredice
208331.description:
A strategic faction based die stacking and siege game. Take control of an elemental faction waging war over ancient ruins. Earn points by rebuilding ruins as high as you can; however, be wary of your adversaries who will try and knock them down with their siege engines. As seen at PAX West 2016 in the Indie Megabooth.

Each turn players perform an action to explore new territory, move or fire their siege engine, or take control of territory with their leader. Then they roll dice to build up the ancient ruins on the board. The taller a ruin is, the more points it is worth but the bigger target it is to be knocked down by an enemy siege engine. Dice knocked out of play are captured and worth points at the end of the game.

At the end of the game, whoever has the most points currently on the board wins. There are five different scoring objectives (ruin height, color matching, captured enemy dice, faction objectives, and your faction leader's control) which can all contribute to your victory.

208332.name: Hydra Castle Labyrinth
208332.description:
User Summary

Hydra Castle Labyrinth is a Metroidvania platformer with a wide array of powerups to find, several of which are optional. You progress through a series of dungeons, which will give you a key to the next dungeon upon completion.

208333.name: Er*bert
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette (Alternative Software re-release) edition
English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette (Power Soft re-release) edition
English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
208333.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Q*bert.




From the inlay:

Fast & Funny - it's 'Erberts cubic domain!

But it's help he needs to avoid his unwanted guests.

User Summary

Er*bert is based on the classic arcade game Q*bert. The game is based on a coloured pyramid of cubes. The aim of the game is to jump from cube to cube, changing the colour of each. On early levels each cube needs to be stepped on once, on others the colours need to be changed multiple times. The player must avoid various creatures, and also avoid jumping off the edge.

208334.description:
A promo card for "Legends of Andor: The last hope" for legends 12-17.
"Kaum ein Chronist erwähnte den kleinen gerissenen Handelszwerg und es scheint auch mehr als abwegig, dass er sich dem Tross der Andori anschloss. Unwegsames Gelände ohne Städte oder sonst jemanden der mit ihm Handel treiben könnte.
Nun, der Legende nach gab es großartige Edelsteine in den Höhlen des Grauen Gebirges. Und ja, es könnte sein, dass die Gier nach diesen Gemmen die Furcht des Handelszwergs bezwang ..."
Available at SPIEL'16 or as download the KOSMOS website after the fair.
208334.name: Die Legenden von Andor – Garz der Handelszwerg

208335.description:
Promo card for "Legends of Andor: The last hope".
For the legends 12-16.
Randomizes the Sunrise box sequence.
208335.name: Legenden von Andor: Das Chaos

208336.name: Comtec Mouse
208336.description:
User Summary

Ball mouse with two buttons and a D9-pin jack.

208337.name: Forestaurant
208337.description:
Forestaurant is a cooperative board game in which the players are tasked to manage a restaurant for animals. Various species can visit your restaurant, and you have to be aware of their different tastes: watch where you seat them, which meal you suggest them, and how you prepare the food.

Your goal is to earn the respect of every species. To accomplish this, you have time until closing, which comes after the deck runs out. And watch out, if the guests are discontent, you can lose the game earlier!

Players take turns one after the other, and their turn consists of three phases. In the Activation phase, a row or column of tables are activated based on the top card of the deck. The activated guests may advance to their next state or their stress levels can increase. The second phase is the Action phase, where the player can take various actions: seat new guests, take orders, prepare and serve meals, and buy ingredients. The player has to play a card for each action, and based on the type of the card, the interaction can decrease or increase the stress level of the guest. In the Ending phase, the player discards the ingredients exceeding the storage limit, and draws new cards. The most interesting part is the preparation of meals, where other players can also play cards and pay ingredients to help the current player.

208339.name: Fast Eddie's Pool and Billiards
208339.description:
Back of game box
Grab you cue and head for Fast Eddie's, the most realistic simulation of pool and billiards for the Amiga Computer.

At Fast Eddie's you can choose from among fourteen different games among four tables including:
Pocket Pool Games
15 ball, 9 Ball Plus, 8 Ball, Wild Sevens, 6 Ball, Golf, Moon, Cut Throat, 14.1, Rotation
Plus
Bumper Pook Table
Carom Billiards Table
Snooker Table

Whether you consider yourself a novice, expert or legend you can select your level of expertise. You can play alone, with up to four other players, against the computer or have your Amiga computer simulate up to four players.

You can practice pre-defined trick shots, or set up your own trick shots. User definable Preferences allows you to show path of the cue while the use of video recorder enables you ro immortalize your best shorts or near misses.

Fast Eddie's includes real world handling of Scratch and cue ball spins. To add ti the atmosphere of the pool hall, there are high quality digitalized sounds and an abundance of colorful remarks from your opponents and the pool hall manager.

If you fire of pool, you can play the Arcade Game in the back corner of the pool hall.

Fast Eddies includes an extensive manual describing the background and rules of each game to borh inform and entertain you.

208340.name: CONGO
208340.description:
Game description from the publisher:

CONGO is a game of adventure played with miniatures and taking place in a unexplored, fantasized, wild, dangerous and enchanted Africa, as imagined by newspapers at the end of the 19th century.

Playing a game of Congo, you might head a scientific expedition, a ferocious tribe, a group of slave traffickers out of Zanzibar or take command of a warband of Azandes, defending to their last drop of blood their culture and their lands!

Each Player's column will be made up of around 30 figures, including colourful characters.

The Adventures related by Le Bulletin de la Société Géographique are at the heart of the game. As you live them out, you will cross a giant ape protected by fierce guardians, try to take back a princess captures by Zanzibari slavers, and cross rivers teeming with crocodiles... Thanks to sheer perseverance, you may even discover the source of the Congo river itself.

Congo is, however, a hostile environment in which wild animals and witchcraft abound... Not to mention many other surprises.

208341.name: Incantesium
208341.description:
Incantesium is a card game where 2-5 wizards face each other in a magic duel through elemental spells.
Each player starts with 10 cards and the purpose is to terminate the opponent cards.
Each turn a player throws a spell following the magic flow of the card on the table: if the flow is correct (same or opposite element of the last played card) the spell is active and he can cure himself or attack an opponent.

208342.name: The Hellion
208342.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Ring-a-ring-a-roses, A pocket full of posies; Ashes! Ashes! You all... Burn... Down!”

Hellions are as adorable as a child could ever be but there is a dark twist about them, something sinister, an evil shadow always following them around. The dark forces behind a hellion’s power manifests at different times depending on the child in question. Some children are born with this darkness, others are victims of a ritual, while a small amount of them seek them willfully.

This product contains two files:

A 20 page playbook containing over 20 moves, some gear and magic items
A two page character sheet for you to record your character's stats, gear, and moves.

208343.name: 4Saken
208343.description:
From publisher blurb:

Horror gaming that’s easy and exciting- it’s… 4Saken!

“Jamie? Dave? Where are you guys? They must be in that dark cabin up ahead…”

Are you a fan of exciting horror cinema? Does your top ten favorites include Invasion of the Body Snatchers, Evil Dead, The Fog, They Live, An American Werewolf in London, Gremlins, The Fly, Re-Animator, Night of the Living Dead or 30 Days of Night? Then 4Saken from Purple Duck Games might just be the tabletop role-playing game for you! Based on the popular 4C System for superhero roleplaying, 4Saken is a toolkit for crafting and playing your own horror-genre games, all nicely contained in less than 100 pages, scary stories and bone-chilling art included! Players take on the role of Survivors, people just a little bit better than the ordinary potential victim strolling around, who get caught up in the strange, mysterious and deadly events that are taking place just beyond the prosaic veneer of peaceful everyday life… which is why the authorities don’t believe them when they say that the mayor is really a supernatural monster wearing human skin! 4Saken has all you need to start playing, including:

Survivor character creation rules, melding Background, Skills, Traits, Contacts, Gifts, and the all-important Instincts, which details what your Survivor does when they are overcome with fear!
Mechanics for regular play using the 4C Master Table and how to manipulate it, with details on combat, weapons, movement and hazards.
FEAR! –and how terror of the unknown and deadly hazards just beyond the edge of shadow can affect your Survivor!
For the Director, who crafts your journey through horror; a collection of macabre Menaces to challenge the survivors, as well as supporting cast and deadly animals.
Invaluable advice for Directors on how to make your 4Saken sessions give all the horror-movie themed game action you are looking for- fighting against forces you cannot comprehend, let alone hope to easily defeat…
Two spine-chilling sample adventures, Dead Man’s Recurve and Perchance to Scream, complete with maps, Director’s notes, and tons of horrific action your Survivor may not survive, should they choose not to run.

208344.name: The Giggling Deep
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
208344.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Giggling Deep describes an underground location with unique properties that will draw wizards and elves back again and again. Other character types may find things of interest to them. The Goremera offers a unique combat challenge, and warriors may be tracking the beast to avenge its victims. Thieves are given three potential prizes – the Goremera’s hoard, a shrine to loot, and a creature whose cooked flesh aids in combating poisons. Clerics of the Hidden Lord may need to reach His shrine to achieve some quest. Clerics of opposed deities may be sending their minions to destroy it. Giving multiple PCs different (and sometimes contradictory!) purposes in entering the region results in the most fun.

208345.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells I (PRD)
208345.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208346.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells I (3PP)
208346.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208347.name: Divided We Fall
208347.description:
Unite and fight your way to victory! Divided we Fall is a strategic close-combat multiplayer game that emphasizes the importance of building an effective cohesive squad and executing well thought-out tactics on the battlefield.

Source: The Game Website.

208348.name: Awesomenauts Assemble!
208348.description:
User Summary

The year is 3587. Conflict spans the stars as huge robot armies are locked in an enduring stalemate.

208349.name: MinosMaze: The Minotaur's Labyrinth
208349.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




User Summary

Theseus is locked in Minotaur's labyrinth, help him escape!

208350.name: The Tale of Doris and the Dragon - Episode 1
208350.description:
The Tale of Doris and the Dragon is an episodic, point-and-click adventure game series featuring an elderly lady named Doris who finds herself in Purgatory after passing away on earth.

Source: The Game Website.

208351.name: Black Sand Drift
208351.description:
User Summary

For over 300 years, the five planets of the Kotiro galaxy have struggled under the heavy hand of maniacal, mechanical bots called Spiral.

208352.name: Line of Sight
208352.description:
Whether you like to play games casually for fun or competitively for E-Sports, you'll be in for an awesome experience.

Source: The Game Website.

208353.name: Genie Express: 1001 Deliveries
208353.description:
Welcome to the ancient and wondrous city of Jadid. Its streets are a bustling hive of activity. Traders and merchants doing business and how do tehir goods get transported? A network of flying carpet couriers deliver these goods from one location to another!

In this magical, fun game you play delivery men trying to fulfill contracts. Really? Yes, but you're not ordinary delivery men! Your delivery vehicle is a genie-powered flying carpet and you're roaring through twisting and turning city streets in a frenzied race to make the biggest profit.

Grab the most lucrative contract or be sneaky and steal one from a rival! Ram your opponents' carpets into buildings or target them with genie power-ups! Spend coin to boost your carpet's abilities and avoid the mischievous genie wandering around town!

In Genie Express: 1001 Deliveries, players move to a location on the modular board to pick up contracts and then plotting a course to the drop off location. Movement is determined by rolling a pool of special movement dice. Completing a contract gains you gold. A player wins by getting to a pre-determined amount of gold first. Players compete to pickup the limited number of contracts so you better be quick otherwise your rivals will beat you to the winning goal!

208354.name: Hail To The Chimp: The Presidential Party Game
208354.description:
In the game, up to four players compete as anthropomorphic animals in a variety of mini-games while vying for the role of "President of the Animal Kingdom".
Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hail_to_the_Chimp,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208355.name: Elemental Spells
208355.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beyond the firmament lies the maelstrom of elemental planes, where the fabric of all things begins. The elemental planes: Where fires rage in an infinite expanse of heart and light, where the rich and loamy earth consumes all, where air grows heavy, grinding upon unseeing gears, where water flows forever to no end. It is here that the base of all power lies and it is here that the elemental lords must turn.

Join the elementals to your spell casters. Unearthed in this text are a host of new spells for your Castles & Crusades game. Written by the wild hand of James M. Ward, these spells bring a whole new world to life and place the magic of it at the finger-tips of your favorite spell caster.

208356.name: Phineas and Ferb: Mission Achterbahn
208356.description:
Phineas and Ferb have a mission: They want to build the coolest rollercoaster in the world. With tactival thinking and luck, you can make it together. But beware: taddle-tale Candace and the mean Dr. Doofenschrmirtz will do everything to destroy the build!

The player flips a few coins. If they land with the right side up, they get to move their token. This way they can collect pieces of their own puzzle, which shows a picture of the Rollercoaster! The first one to collect all the different pieces, AND makes it to the House, wins!
There is a risk, though. Candace can also move, and when she gets home before one of the players, she will tell mom and the plan is foiled!

208357.name: You have 10 seconds
208357.description:
Source: The Game Website.

You Have 10 Seconds is a fast paced arcade style platformer game with over 40 levels.

In the game every single level is on a 10 second timer, so you have 10 seconds to get from the start of the level to the end without dying and before time runs out.

208358.name: You have 10 seconds 2
208358.description:
Source: The Game Website.

You Have 10 Seconds 2 is the sequel to the popular Free to Play game "You Have 10 Seconds".

You Have 10 Seconds 2 is a fast paced, Free to Play platformer game where you have 10 seconds to get from the start of each level to the end before time runs out and without dying. Each area consists of 10 levels and you unlock new areas by completing them, as-well as getting new items.

208359.name: Disparity
208359.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Disparity is a retro puzzle platformer game that focuses on using one single mechanic to get through various levels. Switch the polarity of levels to re-adjust the stage and affect things like magnets and light sensors to help you progress.

The game features six main networks, each with 10 playable levels and different mechanics that can be affected by the polarity swapping ability, along with two secret networks that can discovered while playing through the main game. The game's storyline is explained through cryptic cut scenes at the end of every network, and depending on specific actions you take while going through certain networks a second ending to the game can be triggered. There are 7 unique boss fights in the game along with a final boss at the end of the game that changes depending on what ending you get. The game features a completely original chiptune soundtrack with over 25 different tracks that play in various areas and gamepad support.

208360.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Venture Party is a fun and simple, 3-7 player, card handling game. Fantasy themes and RPG tropes are turned on their head in this game full of clumsy and unfortunate heroes. The land is ripe with opportunity, and only one Venture Party will come out on top. Will it be yours?

BREAKDOWN: The "Character Cards" represent a disposable party member, each with a Power Level value from 1 to 16. The cards have varying effects depending on their Power Level (gathering loot, removing player cards, look at a players hand etc.) "Loot Tokens" on the other hand add +1 to your party's overall power. Loot handling becomes a big part of the game and can sometimes make the difference between the winning and losing parties.

The goal is to end the game with the highest score, which is a total of your Hero Power Levels, and your Loot Tokens. The game begins by dealing 2 Character Cards, and 1 Loot Token to every player. Each turn you draw one party member and play one party member. The game ends when the deck runs out, and everyone adds up their score.
208360.name: Venture Party

208361.name: Serial Cleaner
208361.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.





Serial Cleaner is a story-driven, fast-paced stealth/action game, characterized by a 1970s theme and aesthetics. The protagonist cleans up murder scenes by disposing bodies, covering up blood stains and hiding murder weapons and other incriminating evidence.Exploring, experimenting and fast paced decision making are the key words here. Getting caught and questioned would put a black mark on the protagonist’s career and the environment is often crawling with itchy-fingered police officers accompanied by nosy bystanders. The game uses Real-World Data to modify gameplay according to the time of day in player’s location.

Source: The Developer Website.

208362.name: Death Squared
208362.description:
Put simply, Death Squared is about maneuvering robots through small levels onto coloured circles. The only issue is the multitude of deadly traps and obstacles that stand in your way. Players will need to co-ordinate, co-operate, and learn from each mistake to collectively discover the path to a solution.







Source: The Developer Website.

208363.name: Blind
208363.description:
There are several kinds of blindness and I wonder, now, what can’t you see.

Blind is a narrative-driven psychological thriller for virtual reality where the player is blind and must explore their surroundings using echolocation.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
208364.description:
Concordia: Gallia / Corsica is an expansion for Concordia that contains two maps for new strategic challenges:


In Gallia, you start moving around with only one land colonist and have to settle inside one of the harbor cities before you can use your sea colonist as well.



In Corsica, you will play on the tightest map ever published for Concordia, containing only twenty cities in eight provinces.


Both maps can be played at all player counts, but Corsica is especially meant for two or three players.
208364.name: Concordia: Gallia / Corsica

208365.name: Mr. Shifty
videogamehonor: 2017 PAX Curse Award Best in Show Winner
208365.description:
User Summary

Shift through bullets, and master lightning-fast takedowns.

208366.name: New Hot Shots Golf
208366.description:
User Summary

Newest Hot Shots Golf game.

208367.name: Matka
208367.description:
A travel game set in Scandinavia. Players must play travel cards in order to travel around Scandinavia, trying to collect a post card from each of the five countries. First one to do that and then return to the starting city wins the game.

There's also some trivia involved, but it's just purely optional flavour. The game play is very simple play a card and move a space.

208368.name: ALIENS: Colonial Marines Technical Manual
208368.description:
From the introduction:

THE UNITED STATES COLONIAL MARINES (USCM)

The 'United States Colonial Marine Corps is America's interstellar force-in-readiness. This role, distinct from that of the US Army, stems from the country's position as a starfaring, colonising power, and its leading role within the structure of the United Americas. Though the term "Marine" has its roots in describing a soldier who fought from ships at sea, in the modern era it has become synonymous with those elite forces of soldiers who are always read to fight, regardless of their nation's readiness for war, and who are capable of operating far from home soil.
